interface.name: ApplicationCache
interface.description: The Application Cache (AppCache) lets web-based applications run offline. Developers can specify resources for the browser to cache, making them available to the application even if no connection can be made to the server. These resources load and work correctly even if users click the refresh button when they are offline.

method.name: abort
method.description: Cancels the application cache download process. This method is intended to be used by Web applications showing their own caching progress UI, in case the user wants to stop the update (e.g., because bandwidth is limited).

method.name: swapCache
method.description:
Switches to the most recent application cache, if there is a newer one. If there isn't, throws an InvalidStateError exception.

This does not cause previously-loaded resources to be reloaded; for example, images do not suddenly get reloaded and style sheets and scripts do not get reparsed or reevaluated. The only change is that subsequent requests for cached resources will obtain the newer copies.

The updateready event will fire before this method can be called. Once it fires, the Web application can, at its leisure, call this method to switch the underlying cache to the one with the more recent updates. To make proper use of this, applications have to be able to bring the new features into play; for example, reloading scripts to enable new features. An easier alternative to swapCache() is just to reload the entire page at a time suitable for the user, using location.reload().

method.name: update
method.description: Invokes the application cache download process. Throws an InvalidStateError exception if there is no application cache to update. Calling this method is not usually necessary, as user agents will generally take care of updating application caches automatically. The method can be useful in situations such as long-lived applications. For example, a Web mail application might stay open in a browser tab for weeks at a time. Such an application could want to test for updates each day.

property.name: oncached
property.description: The resources listed in the manifest have been downloaded, and the application is now cached.

property.name: onchecking
property.description: The user agent is checking for an update, or attempting to download the manifest for the first time. This is always the first event in the sequence.

property.name: ondownloading
property.description: The user agent has found an update and is fetching it, or is downloading the resources listed by the manifest for the first time.

property.name: onerror
property.description: Indicates an error has occurred.

property.name: onnoupdate
property.description: Indicates the manifest has not changed.

property.name: onobsolete
property.description: The Webpage is associated with an application cache whose group is marked as obsolete.

property.name: onprogress
property.description: The user agent is downloading resources listed by the manifest. The event object's total attribute returns the total number of files to be downloaded. The event object's loaded attribute returns the number of files processed so far.

property.name: onupdateready
property.description: The ApplicationCache object's cache host is associated with an application cache whose application cache group's update status is idle, and whose application cache group is not marked as obsolete, but that application cache is not the newest cache in its group.

property.name: status
property.description: Returns the current status of the application cache, as given by the constants defined below.

interface.name: AudioTrack
interface.description: AudioTrack is an object representing an audio portion of a video element.

property.name: enabled
property.description: Returns true if the given track is active, and false otherwise. Can be set, to change whether the track is enabled or not. If multiple audio tracks are enabled simultaneously, they are mixed.

property.name: id
property.description: Returns the ID of the given track. This is the ID that can be used with a fragment identifier if the format supports the Media Fragments URI syntax, and that can be used with the getTrackById() method.

property.name: kind
property.description: Returns the category the given track falls into.

property.name: label
property.description: Returns the label of the given track, if known, or the empty string otherwise.

property.name: language
property.description: Returns the language of the given track, if known, or the empty string otherwise.

interface.name: AudioTrackList
interface.description: An AudioTrackList object represents a dynamic list of zero or more audio tracks, of which zero or more can be enabled at a time. Each audio track is represented by an AudioTrack object.

method.name: getTrackById
method.description: Returns the AudioTrack object with the given identifier, or null if no track has that identifier.

property.name: length
property.description: Returns the number of tracks in the list.

interface.name: TextTrack
interface.description: A media element can have a group of associated text tracks, known as the media element's "list of text tracks".

method.name: addCue
method.description: Adds the given cue to textTrack's text track list of cues.

parameter.name: cue
parameter.description: "cue" is of type TextTrackCue.

method.name: removeCue
method.description: Removes the given cue from textTrack's text track list of cues.

parameter.name: cue
parameter.description: "cue" is of type TextTrackCue.

property.name: activeCues
property.description: Returns the text track cues from the text track list of cues that are currently active (i.e. that start before the current playback position and end after it), as a TextTrackCueList object.

property.name: cues
property.description: Returns the text track list of cues, as a TextTrackCueList object.

property.name: inBandMetadataTrackDispatchType
property.description: Returns the text track in-band metadata track dispatch type string.

property.name: kind
property.description: Returns the text track kind string.

property.name: label
property.description: Returns the text track label, if there is one, or the empty string otherwise (indicating that a custom label probably needs to be generated from the other attributes of the object if the object is exposed to the user).

property.name: language
property.description: Returns the text track language string.

property.name: mode
property.description: The text track mode, represented by a string from the following list. "disabled": The text track disabled mode. "hidden": The text track hidden mode. "showing": The text track showing mode.

interface.name: TextTrackCue
interface.description: A text track cue is the unit of time-sensitive data in a text track corresponding, for instance, for subtitles and captions to the text that appear at a particular time and disappear at another time.

method.name: getCueAsHTML
method.description: Returns the text track cue text as a DocumentFragment of HTML elements and other DOM nodes.
method.return_description: DocumentFragment: A document fragment that represents the TextTrackCue text.

property.name: align
property.description: A string representing the text track cue alignment, as follows. If it is start alignment: the string "start". If it is middle alignment: the string "middle". If it is end alignment: the string "end". If it is left alignment: the string "left". If it is right alignment: the string "right".

property.name: endTime
property.description: The text track cue end time, in seconds.

property.name: id
property.description: The text track cue identifier.

property.name: line
property.description: The text track cue line position. In the case of the value being auto, the string "auto" is returned.

property.name: pauseOnExit
property.description: The text track cue pause-on-exit flag.

property.name: position
property.description: The text track cue text position.

property.name: size
property.description: The text track cue size.

property.name: snapToLines
property.description: The text track cue snap-to-lines flag.

property.name: startTime
property.description: The text track cue start time, in seconds.

property.name: text
property.description: The text track cue text in raw unparsed form.

property.name: track
property.description: Returns the TextTrack object to which this text track cue belongs, if any, or null otherwise.

property.name: vertical
property.description: A string representing the text track cue writing direction, as follows. If it is horizontal: The empty string. If it is vertical growing left: The string "rl". If it is vertical growing right: The string "lr".

interface.name: TextTrackCueList
interface.description: A TextTrackCueList object represents a dynamically updating list of text track cues in a given order.

method.name: getCueById
method.description: Returns the first text track cue (in text track cue order) with text track cue identifier id. Returns null if none of the cues have the given identifier or if the argument is the empty string.

parameter.name: idString
parameter.description: id for a specific TextTrackCue .

property.name: length
property.description: The length attribute returns the number of cues in the list represented by the TextTrackCueList.

interface.name: TextTrackList
interface.description: A TextTrackList object represents a dynamically updating list of text tracks in a given order.

property.name: length
property.description: The length attribute of a TextTrackList object returns the number of text tracks in the list represented by the TextTrackList.

interface.name: TimeRanges
interface.description: A TimeRanges object represents the collection of ranges (time periods) from the media resource that have been buffered or played. Ranges in a TimeRanges collection are sequential and not empty. Adjacent ranges are combined together to create longer ones.

method.name: end
method.description: Returns the time for the end of the range with the given index. Throws an IndexSizeError if the index is out of range.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT. This method can return one of these values.

{| class="wikitable"

|-

!Return code

!Description

|-

|S_OK

|The operation completed successfully.

|-

|IndexSizeError

|The specified index is out of range.

|}

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The zero-based index of the item in the collection.

method.name: start
method.description: Returns the time for the start of the range with the given index. Throws an IndexSizeError if the index is out of range.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT. This method can return one of these values.

{| class="wikitable"

|-

!Return code

!Description

|-

|S_OK

|The operation completed successfully.

|-

|IndexSizeError

|The specified index is out of range.

|}

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The zero-based index of the item in the collection.

property.name: length
property.description: Returns the number of ranges in the object.

interface.name: TrackEvent
interface.description: A TrackEvent object exposes (via its track attribute) the track to which an event relates.

property.name: track
property.description: Returns the track object (TextTrack, AudioTrack, or VideoTrack) to which the event relates.

interface.name: CanvasGradient
interface.description: An opaque object of the canvas API.

method.name: addColorStop
method.description: Adds a new stop to a gradient. If offset is less than 0 or greater than 1 then an IndexSizeError exception must be thrown. If the color cannot be parsed as a CSS value, then a SyntaxError exception must be thrown. Otherwise the gradient must have a new stop placed, at offset offset relative to the whole gradient, and with the color obtained by parsing color as a CSS value.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: A floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the position between the start and end points in a gradient.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: A CSS color string to display at the position that the offset parameter specifies.

interface.name: CanvasPattern
interface.description: An opaque object of the canvas API. See Notes.

interface.name: CanvasPixelArray
interface.description: Specifies each pixel within a canvas's rectangular selection, via the ImageData object's data property. The array uses four elements to represent each pixel's red, green, blue, and alpha channels. See Notes.

interface.name: CanvasRenderingContext2D
interface.description: The 2D rendering context for the drawing surface of a element.

method.name: addHitRegion
method.description: Creates a hit region.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: This parameter is of type HitRegionOptions. See Related Specifications for details.

method.name: arc
method.description: Draws the specified arc.
method.return_description:
Type: string

This method can return the following value.

{| class="wikitable"

|-

!Return code

!Description

|-

|IndexSizeError

|The specified radius value is negative.

|}

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, for the center point of the arc in relation to the upper-left corner of the canvas rectangle.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, for the center point of the arc in relation to the upper-left corner of the canvas rectangle.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: The radius or distance from the point (x,y) that the arc's path follows.

parameter.name: startAngle
parameter.description: The starting angle, in radians, where 0 is at the 3 o'clock position of the arc's circle.

parameter.name: endAngle
parameter.description: The ending angle, in radians.

parameter.name: anticlockwise
parameter.description:
true: The arc is drawn in a counterclockwise direction from start to end.

false: The arc is drawn in a clockwise direction from start to end.

method.name: arcTo
method.description: Check to be sure there's a subpath for (x1, y1). Then, the behavior depends on the arguments and the last point in the subpath. See Notes.

parameter.name: x1
parameter.description: The x-coordinate for the first tangent that intersects with the current path point.

parameter.name: y1
parameter.description: The y-coordinate for the first tangent that intersects with the current point.

parameter.name: x2
parameter.description: The x-coordinate for the second tangent that intersects with the x1 and y1 points.

parameter.name: y2
parameter.description: The y-coordinate for the second tangent that intersects with the x1 and y1 points.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: The radius of the arc to create.

method.name: beginPath
method.description: Empties the list of subpaths in the context's current default path so that it once again has zero subpaths.

method.name: bezierCurveTo
method.description: Ensures there is a subpath for (cp1x, cp1y), then connects the last point in the subpath to the given point (x, y) using a cubic Bézier curve with control points (cp1x, cp1y) and (cp2x, cp2y), then adds the point (x, y) to the subpath.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: cp1x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the first Bézier control point.

parameter.name: cp1y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the first Bézier control point.

parameter.name: cp2x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the second Bézier control point.

parameter.name: cp2y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the second Bézier control point.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the point to add to the current path.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the point to add to the current path.

method.name: clearRect
method.description: Clears all pixels on the canvas in the given rectangle (x, y, w, h) to transparent black.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: w
parameter.description: The width, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: h
parameter.description: The height, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

method.name: clip
method.description: Specifies a new clipping region by calculating the intersection of the current clipping region and the area described by the intended path, using the non-zero winding number rule. The new clipping region replaces the current clipping region.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

method.name: closePath
method.description: Marks the last subpath as closed, creates a new subpath whose first point is the same as the previous subpath's first point, and then adds the new subpath to the path. If the object's path has no subpaths, this method does nothing.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

method.name: createImageData
method.description: Depending on how it is called, returns either an ImageData object with the given sw, sh dimensions or an ImageData object with the same dimensions as the imagedata argument. See Notes.
method.return_description: An ImageData object.

parameter.name: sw
parameter.description: The width of the new object, in CSS pixels.

parameter.name: sh
parameter.description: The height of the new object, in CSS pixels.

parameter.name: imagedata
parameter.description: An ImageData object of the desired width and height.

method.name: createLinearGradient
method.description: Returns a linear CanvasGradient initialized with the specified line as represented by the start point (x0, y0) and end point (x1, y1) of the gradient.
method.return_description: A CanvasGradient object that represents the new linear gradient.

parameter.name: x0
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the start point of the gradient.

parameter.name: y0
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the start point of the gradient.

parameter.name: x1
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the end point of the gradient.

parameter.name: y1
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the end point of the gradient.

method.name: createPattern
method.description: Returns a CanvasPattern object that uses the given image and repeats in the direction(s) given by the repetition argument.
method.return_description:
CanvasPattern

The pattern object to use as a fill style together with a CanvasRenderingContext2D object.

parameter.name: image
parameter.description: An image, canvas, or video element of the pattern to use. If the image has no image data, throws an InvalidStateError exception. If the image is not yet fully decoded, the method returns null.

parameter.name: repetition
parameter.description:
The direction of repetition. The allowed values for repetition are:

  • "repeat" (both directions; default)
  • "repeat-x" (horizontal only)
  • "repeat-y" (vertical only)
  • "no-repeat" (neither).

If the parameter does not match one of the allowed values, the method throws a SyntaxError exception.

method.name: createRadialGradient
method.description: Returns a radial CanvasGradient initialized with the two specified circles. This effectively creates a cone, touched by the two circles defined in the creation of the gradient, with the part of the cone before the start circle (0.0) using the color of the first offset, the part of the cone after the end circle (1.0) using the color of the last offset, and areas outside the cone (untouched by the gradient) transparent black.
method.return_description: A CanvasGradient object that represents the radial gradient.

parameter.name: x0
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the starting circle of the gradient.

parameter.name: y0
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the starting circle of the gradient.

parameter.name: r0
parameter.description: The radius of the starting circle.

parameter.name: x1
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the ending circle of the gradient.

parameter.name: y1
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the ending circle of the gradient.

parameter.name: r1
parameter.description: The radius of the ending circle.

method.name: drawCustomFocusRing
method.description: Draw a focus ring of the appropriate style along the intended path, and sets result to false.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path along which the focus ring is to be drawn.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The element on which the focus ring is to be drawn.

method.name: drawImage
method.description: Draws the specified image onto the canvas. Can be called in three ways; see Notes.

parameter.name: image
parameter.description: An image, canvas, or video element of the pattern to use.

parameter.name: sx
parameter.description: The horizontal starting value (x), in CSS pixels, relative to the source image.

parameter.name: sy
parameter.description: The vertical starting value (y), in CSS pixels, relative to the source image.

parameter.name: sw
parameter.description: The width of the source image, in CSS pixels, to draw onto the canvas.

parameter.name: sh
parameter.description: The height of the source image, in CSS pixels, to draw onto the canvas.

parameter.name: dx
parameter.description: The horizontal (x) value, in CSS pixels, where to place the image on the canvas.

parameter.name: dy
parameter.description: The vertical (y) value, in CSS pixels, where to place the image on the canvas.

parameter.name: dw
parameter.description: The destination width value, in CSS pixels, to use when drawing the image to the canvas.

parameter.name: dh
parameter.description: The destination height value, in CSS pixels, to use when drawing the image to the canvas.

method.name: drawSystemFocusRing
method.description: Draws a focus ring of the appropriate style along the intended path, following platform conventions.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path along which the focus ring is to be drawn.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The element on which the focus ring is to be drawn.

method.name: ellipse
method.description: Draws the specified ellipse. If the object's path has any subpaths, this method adds a straight line from the last point in the subpath to the start point of the arc. Then, it adds the start and end points of the arc to the subpath, and connects them with an arc.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

{| class="wikitable"

|-

!Return code

!Description

|-

|S_OK

|The operation completed successfully.

|-

|IndexSizeError

|The specified radius value is negative.

|}

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, for the center point of the arc in relation to the upper-left corner of the canvas rectangle.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, for the center point of the arc in relation to the upper-left corner of the canvas rectangle.

parameter.name: radiusX
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, from the point (x,y) that the arc's path follows.

parameter.name: radiusY
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, from the point (x,y) that the arc's path follows.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: The rotation, in radians, the semi-major axis is inclined clockwise from the x-axis.

parameter.name: startAngle
parameter.description: The starting angle, in radians, where 0 is at the 3 o'clock position of the arc's circle.

parameter.name: endAngle
parameter.description: The starting angle, in radians.

parameter.name: anticlockwise
parameter.description:
true: The arc is drawn in a counterclockwise direction from start to end.

false: The arc is drawn in a clockwise direction from start to end.

method.name: fill
method.description: Fills all the subpaths of the intended path, using fillStyle, and using the non-zero winding number rule. Open subpaths must be implicitly closed when being filled (without affecting the actual subpaths).
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path to be filled.

method.name: fillRect
method.description: Paints the specified rectangular area using the color (or style) defined by fillStyle.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas. With value 0, the method has no effect.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The height, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas. With value 0, the method has no effect.

method.name: fillText
method.description: Renders the given text at the given (x, y) coordinates, ensuring that the text isn't wider than maxWidth (if specified), using the current font, textAlign, and textBaseline values.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text characters to paint on the canvas.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The horizontal coordinate to start painting the text at, relative to the canvas.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The vertical coordinate to start painting the text, relative to the canvas.

parameter.name: maxWidth
parameter.description: The maximum possible text width. If the value is less than the width property, the text is scaled to fit.

method.name: getImageData
method.description: Returns an ImageData object representing the underlying pixel data for the area of the canvas denoted by the rectangle whose corners are the four points (sx, sy), (sx+sw, sy), (sx+sw, sy+sh), (sx, sy+sh), in canvas coordinate space units.
method.return_description:
ICanvasImageData

A CanvasImageData object with pixel information from the canvas within the specified coordinates.

parameter.name: sx
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: sy
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: sw
parameter.description: The width, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: sh
parameter.description: The height, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

method.name: getLineDash
method.description: Gets the line dash properties for the stroke.
method.return_description: An array of integers that specifies the length of each "on" and "off" segment.

method.name: isPointInPath
method.description: Returns true if the point given by the x and y coordinates passed to the method, when treated as coordinates in the canvas coordinate space unaffected by the current transformation, is inside the intended path as determined by the non-zero winding number rule; returns false otherwise. If either of the arguments is infinite or NaN, then the method returns false.
method.return_description:
Type: VARIANT_BOOL

This method can return one of these values.

{| class="wikitable"

|-

!Return value

!Description

|-

|false

|The point is not in the current path.

|-

|true

|The point is in the current path.

|}

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate to test.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate to test.

method.name: lineTo
method.description: Connects the last point in the subpath to the given point (x, y) using a straight line, and then adds the point to the subpath.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels.

method.name: moveTo
method.description: Creates a new subpath with the specified point as its first (and only) point.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels.

method.name: putImageData
method.description: Writes data from ImageData structures back to the canvas. If any of the arguments are infinite or NaN, the method must throw a NotSupportedError exception. When the last four arguments are omitted, they are assumed to have the values 0, 0, the width member of the imagedata structure, and the height member of the imagedata structure, respectively.

parameter.name: imagedata
parameter.description: An ImageData object with an image's pixel data.

parameter.name: dx
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: dy
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: dirtyX
parameter.description: The horizontal (x) value, in CSS pixels, where to place the image on the canvas.

parameter.name: dirtyY
parameter.description: The vertical (y) value, in CSS pixels, where to place the image on the canvas.

parameter.name: dirtyWidth
parameter.description: The destination width value, in CSS pixels, to use to draw the image to the canvas.

parameter.name: dirtyHeight
parameter.description: The destination height value, in CSS pixels to use to draw the image to the canvas.

method.name: quadraticCurveTo
method.description: Ensures there is a subpath for (cpx, cpy), then connects the last point in the subpath to the given point (x, y) using a quadratic Bézier curve with control point (cpx, cpy), and then adds the given point (x, y) to the subpath.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: cp1x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the Bézier control point.

parameter.name: cp1y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the Bézier control point.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the point to add to the current path.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the point to add to the current path.

method.name: rect
method.description: Creates a new subpath containing just the four points (x, y), (x+w, y), (x+w, y+h), (x, y+h), with those four points connected by straight lines, then marks the subpath as closed. It then creates a new subpath with the point (x, y) as the only point in the subpath.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: w
parameter.description: The width, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: h
parameter.description: The height, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

method.name: removeHitRegion
method.description: Removes a previously-defined hit region.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: This parameter is of type HitRegionOptions. See Related Specifications for details.

method.name: restore
method.description: Pops the top entry from the drawing state stack, and reset the drawing state it describes. If there is no saved state, the method does nothing.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

method.name: rotate
method.description: Addd the rotation transformation described by the argument to the transformation matrix. The angle argument represents a clockwise rotation angle expressed in radians.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: angle
parameter.description: The rotation angle, in radians.

method.name: save
method.description: Saves the current state of the context. Use the restore() method to retrieve the saved state.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

method.name: scale
method.description: Adds the scaling transformation described by the arguments to the transformation matrix. The x argument represents the scale factor in the horizontal direction; the y argument represents the scale factor in the vertical direction. The factors are multiples.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The horizontal scaling factor, where 1 equals unity or 100% scale.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The vertical scaling factor.

method.name: scrollPathIntoView
method.description: Scrolls the current path into view. See Notes.

method.name: setLineDash
method.description: Sets the line dash properties for the stroke.

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.description: An array of integers that specifies the length of each "on" and "off" segment.

method.name: setTransform
method.description: Resets the current transform to the identity matrix, and then invokes the transform(a, b, c, d, e, f) method with the same arguments.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: a
parameter.description: The m1,1 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: b
parameter.description: The m1,2 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: c
parameter.description: The m2,1 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: d
parameter.description: The m2,2 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: The delta x (dx) value in the matrix.

parameter.name: f
parameter.description: The delta y (dy) value in the matrix.

method.name: stroke
method.description: Traces the intended path, using the CanvasRenderingContext2D object for the line styles, and then fills the combined stroke area using the strokeStyle attribute.

method.name: strokeRect
method.description: Takes the result of tracing the path, using the CanvasRenderingContext2D object's line styles, and fills it with the strokeStyle.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The x-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The y-coordinate, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: w
parameter.description: The width, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

parameter.name: h
parameter.description: The height, in pixels, of the rectangle in relation to the coordinates of the canvas.

method.name: strokeText
method.description: Renders the given text at the given (x, y) coordinates, ensuring that the text isn't wider than maxWidth (if specified), using the current font, textAlign, and textBaseline values.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text characters to paint on the canvas.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The horizontal coordinate to start painting the text relative to the canvas.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The vertical coordinate of the baseline for the text to start painting, relative to the canvas.

parameter.name: maxWidth
parameter.description: The maximum possible text width. If the value is less than width, the text is scaled to fit.

method.name: transform
method.description:
Replaces the current transformation matrix with the result of multiplying the current transformation matrix with the matrix described by:

a c e

b d f

0 0 1
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: a
parameter.description: The m1,1 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: b
parameter.description: The m1,2 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: c
parameter.description: The m2,1 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: d
parameter.description: The m2,2 value in the matrix.

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: The delta x (dx) value in the matrix.

parameter.name: f
parameter.description: The delta y (dy) value in the matrix.

method.name: translate
method.description: Modifies the transformation matrix of this context by adding the scaling transformation described by the arguments to the transformation matrix. The arguments represent the scale factors in the horizontal (x) and vertical (y) directions. The factors are multiples.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The value to add to horizontal (or x) coordinates.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The value to add to vertical (or y) coordinates.

property.name: html/elements/canvas
property.description: A (read-only) reference to the canvas element that the CanvasRenderingContext2D object was created for.

property.name: fillStyle
property.description: The current style used to fill shapes. The style can be a CanvasGradient, a CanvasPattern, or a string containing a CSS color.

property.name: font
property.description: The current canvas context font and characteristics, in the manner of the CSS font property.

property.name: globalAlpha
property.description: An alpha value that is applied to shapes and images before they are composited onto the canvas.

property.name: globalCompositeOperation
property.description: Sets how shapes and images are drawn onto the existing bitmap once they have had globalAlpha and the current transformation matrix applied.

property.name: lineCap
property.description: Defines the type of endings the user agent will place on the end of lines.

property.name: lineDashOffset
property.description: Specifies the number of pixels to offset the dash pattern.

property.name: lineJoin
property.description: Defines the type of corners the user agent will place where two lines meet.

property.name: lineWidth
property.description: The current line width, in coordinate space units.

property.name: miterLimit
property.description: The current miter limit ratio.

property.name: shadowBlur
property.description: Specifies the level of the blurring effect. The units do not map to coordinate space units, and are not affected by the current transformation matrix.

property.name: shadowColor
property.description: The color of the shadow.

property.name: shadowOffsetX
property.description: Specifies the distance that the shadow will be offset in the positive horizontal distance, in coordinate space units.

property.name: shadowOffsetY
property.description: Specifies the distance that the shadow will be offset in the positive vertical distance, in coordinate space units.

property.name: strokeStyle
property.description: The current style for stroking shapes. The style can be a CanvasGradient, a CanvasPattern, or a string containing a CSS color.

property.name: textAlign
property.description: Returns or sets the text alignment value. See return value description below.

property.name: textBaseline
property.description: Returns or sets the baseline value. See return value description below.

interface.name: ImageData
interface.description: The ImageData object of the canvas API.

property.name: data
property.description: Initialized to a Uint8ClampedArray object. The Uint8ClampedArray object must use a Canvas Pixel ArrayBuffer for its storage, and must have a zero start offset and a length equal to the length of its storage, in bytes.

property.name: height
property.description: The number of rows in the image data.

property.name: width
property.description: The number of physical device pixels per row in the image data.

interface.name: TextMetrics
interface.description: The TextMetrics object of the canvas API. TextMetrics retrieves numeric informations like the width of a text that is drawn onto the canvas with the current font style.

method.name: measureText
method.description: Returns a TextMetrics object that contains the width of the specified text.
method.return_description: ICanvasTextMetrics: The width of the text, in CSS pixels.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to measure.

property.name: actualBoundingBoxAscent
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the top of the bounding rectangle of the given text, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating a distance going up from the given baseline.

property.name: actualBoundingBoxDescent
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the bottom of the bounding rectangle of the given text, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating a distance going down from the given baseline.

property.name: actualBoundingBoxLeft
property.description: The distance parallel to the baseline from the alignment point given by the textAlign attribute to the left side of the bounding rectangle of the given text, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating a distance going left from the given alignment point.

property.name: actualBoundingBoxRight
property.description: The distance parallel to the baseline from the alignment point given by the textAlign attribute to the right side of the bounding rectangle of the given text, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating a distance going right from the given alignment point.

property.name: alphabeticBaseline
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the alphabetic baseline of the line box, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating that the given baseline is below the alphabetic baseline. (Zero if the given baseline is the alphabetic baseline.)

property.name: emHeightAscent
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the top of the em square in the line box, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating that the given baseline is below the top of the em square (so this value will usually be positive). Zero if the given baseline is the top of the em square; half the font size if the given baseline is the middle of the em square.

property.name: emHeightDescent
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the bottom of the em square in the line box, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating that the given baseline is below the bottom of the em square (so this value will usually be negative). (Zero if the given baseline is the top of the em square.)

property.name: fontBoundingBoxAscent
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the top of the highest bounding rectangle of all the fonts used to render the text, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating a distance going up from the given baseline.

property.name: fontBoundingBoxDescent
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the bottom of the lowest bounding rectangle of all the fonts used to render the text, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating a distance going down from the given baseline.

property.name: hangingBaseline
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the hanging baseline of the line box, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating that the given baseline is below the hanging baseline. (Zero if the given baseline is the hanging baseline.)

property.name: ideographicBaseline
property.description: The distance from the horizontal line indicated by the textBaseline attribute to the ideographic baseline of the line box, in CSS pixels; positive numbers indicating that the given baseline is below the ideographic baseline. (Zero if the given baseline is the ideographic baseline.)

property.name: width
property.description: The width of an inline text box, in CSS pixels.

interface.name: CSSRegionStyleRule
interface.description: Represents an @region rule in a CSS style sheet, which applies styles to fragments of content that flow into a CSS region.

interface.name: NamedFlow
interface.description: Represents content to flow among various block region elements. The NamedFlow interface allows access to both the content of the flow and the series of regions in which it displays, and helps determine if the content exceeds or falls short of the number of regions necessary to display it.

method.name: getContent
method.description: Returns a collection of nodes representing the flow's source content.
method.return_description: Returns a collection of nodes representing the flow's source content.

method.name: getRegions
method.description: Returns the series of regions into which content flows.
method.return_description: Returns the series of regions into which content flows.

method.name: getRegionsByContent
method.description: Returns the series of regions that contain at least part of the supplied target content element.
method.return_description: Returns the series of regions that contain at least part of the supplied target content element.

property.name: firstEmptyRegionIndex
property.description: Returns the integer index of the first empty element within a region chain. Returns -1 if the content fits within the region chain or if it exceeds available space.

property.name: name
property.description: Name of flow, as specified by any element's flow-from or flow-into properties.

property.name: overset
property.description: Indicates whether a flow's content exceeds available space within a region chain, or if no available region chain in which to flow content exists.

interface.name: Region
interface.description: The Region interface is available for any element that serves as a CSS region, whose flow-from CSS specifies it displays content from a named flow.

method.name: getComputedRegionStyle
method.description: Returns styles calculated for an element as it appears within a region, including styles from @region rules applied to ranges within the element.
method.return_description: Returns styles calculated for an element as it appears within a region, including styles from @region rules applied to ranges within the element.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The element that contains the desired style settings, regardless of whether it currently appears within the region.

parameter.name: pseudoElementName
parameter.description: The name of a CSS pseudo-element (such as "::before" or "::after") or a null value. Optional in WebKit-based browsers.

method.name: getRegionFlowRanges
method.description: Returns a series of Range objects that represent the fragments of DOM content that currently flow into the region.
method.return_description: Returns a series of Range objects that represent the fragments of DOM content that currently flow into the region.

method.name: ms-get-region-content
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

S_OK

property.name: regionOverset
property.description: A region's display state within a region chain.

interface.name: Blob
interface.description: The Blob object represents immutable raw data. It provides a method to slice data objects between ranges of bytes into further chunks of raw data.

method.name: close
method.description: Releases the file lock for the associated file resource or frees the memory for the Blob object. After calling this method, performing addition operations on the Blob object fails and throws an exception.

method.name: slice
method.description: Returns a new Blob object with bytes ranging from its optional start parameter up to but not including its optional end parameter.
method.return_description: A new Blob object containing the data in the specified range of bytes from the source Blob.

parameter.name: start
parameter.description:
The optional start parameter is a value for the start point of a slice call, and is treated as a byte-order position, with position 0 representing the first byte. If start is negative, it is treated as length + start, where length is the length of the file (this allows byte selection starting from the end of the file).

If you specify a value for start that is larger than the size of the source Blob, the returned Blob has size 0 and contains no data.

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: The optional end parameter is a value for the end point of a slice call. The returned slice of data is up to but does not include the end byte. If end is omitted, slice selects all bytes from the start position to the end of the file. If end is negative, it is treated as length + end, where length is the length of the file (this allows byte selection starting from the end of the file).

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: The optional contentType parameter is used to set a value (identical to one that is set with the HTTP/1.1 Content-Type header) on the Blob returned by the slice call.

interface.name: File
interface.description: The File object provides information about files stored on the user's computer, and access to their contents. These are generally retrieved from a FileList object returned when a user selects files using the input element, or from a drag-and-drop operation's DataTransfer object.

property.name: lastModifiedDate
property.description: The last modified date of the file. On getting, if user agents can make this information available, this must return a new Date object initialized to the last modified date of the file. If the last modification date and time are not known, the attribute must return the current date and time as a Date object.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the file; on getting, this must return the name of the file as a string. There are numerous file name variations on different systems; this is merely the name of the file, without path information. On getting, if user agents cannot make this information available, they must return the empty string.

interface.name: FileError
interface.description:
Represents an error that occurs while using the FileReader interface.

Obsolete per latest specification. Use DOMError instead.

interface.name: FileList
interface.description: FileList is an object which represents an array of individually selected files from the underlying system.

method.name: item
method.description: item returns the indexth File object in the FileList. If there is no indexth File object in the FileList, then this method must return null.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

S_OK

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The FileList index (starting from 0) of the File object to return.

property.name: length
property.description: length returns the number of files in the FileList object. If there are no files, this attribute must return 0.

interface.name: FileReader
interface.description: The FileReader object lets web applications asynchronously read the contents of files (or raw data buffers) stored on the user's computer, using File or Blob objects to specify the file or data to read. File objects may be obtained from a FileList object returned as a result of a user selecting files using the input element, from a drag-and-drop operation's DataTransfer object, or from the mozGetAsFile() API on an HTMLCanvasElement.

method.name: abort
method.description: Aborts a read operation.

method.name: readAsArrayBuffer
method.description: Returns partial Blob data representing the number of bytes currently loaded (as a fraction of the total), as an ArrayBuffer object.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

S_OK

method.name: readAsDataURL
method.description: Returns the complete data of blob as a Data URL.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

S_OK

parameter.name: blob
parameter.description: Represents a chunk of immutable raw data.

method.name: readAsText
method.description: Returns partial Blob data representing the number of bytes currently loaded (as a fraction of the total), decoded into memory according to the encoding determination.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

S_OK

interface.name: FileReaderSync
interface.description: Allows for synchronous reading of File or Blob objects. Only available in Workers, as synchronous I/O would otherwise block the main application from executing.

interface.name: MSStream
interface.description: The MSStream object is a Document Object Model (DOM) type that represents a stream of unsized, sequential binary data.

interface.name: MSStreamError
interface.description:
The MSStreamError object reports file-related errors asynchronously.

Obsolete per latest specification. Use DOMError instead.

interface.name: MSStreamReader
interface.description: Creates random access data (Blob) from an MSStream object.

method.name: readAsBlob
method.description: Performs an asynchronous read of an MSStream object in order to create a Blob object.

parameter.name: stream
parameter.description: The MSStream object to read.

parameter.name: maxSize
parameter.description: String that specifies the maximum size of the object to read.

method.name: readAsText
method.description: Returns partial Blob data representing the number of bytes currently loaded (as a fraction of the total), decoded into memory according to the encoding determination.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

S_OK

property.name: onabort
property.description: Indicates that the read has been aborted (for example, by calling abort()).

interface.name: ObjectURLOptions
interface.description: Provides the oneTimeOnly property for use with the createObjectURL method.

interface.name: URL
interface.description: A static object for URL related utility operations.

method.name: createObjectURL
method.description: Creates a URL for the specified object.
method.return_description: A URL for the specified object.

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: The object that needs a URL. Usually a File.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A dictionary object. See ObjectURLOptions for more information. Used with oneTimeOnly attribute to create a single use URL that does not need to be revoked.

method.name: revokeObjectURL
method.description: Revokes a URL from a document and frees the object associated with that URL.

parameter.name: objectURL
parameter.description: String that indicates the URL to revoke from the document.

interface.name: DirectoryEntry
interface.description: This interface represents a directory on a file system.

method.name: createReader
method.description: Creates a new DirectoryReader to read Entries from this Directory.

method.name: getDirectory
method.description: Creates or looks up a directory.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Either an absolute path or a relative path from this DirectoryEntry to the directory to be looked up or created. It is an error to attempt to create a directory whose immediate parent does not yet exist.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
• If create and exclusive are both true and the path already exists, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is true, the path doesn't exist, and no other error occurs, getDirectory must create and return a corresponding DirectoryEntry.
  • If create is not true and the path doesn't exist, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is not true and the path exists, but is a file, getDirectory must fail.
  • Otherwise, if no other error occurs, getDirectory must return a DirectoryEntry corresponding to path.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called to return the DirectoryEntry selected or created.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: getFile
method.description: Creates or looks up a file.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Either an absolute path or a relative path from this DirectoryEntry to the file to be looked up or created. It is an error to attempt to create a file whose immediate parent does not yet exist.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
• If create and exclusive are both true and the path already exists, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is true, the path doesn't exist, and no other error occurs, getDirectory must create and return a corresponding DirectoryEntry.
  • If create is not true and the path doesn't exist, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is not true and the path exists, but is a file, getDirectory must fail.
  • Otherwise, if no other error occurs, getDirectory must return a DirectoryEntry corresponding to path.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called to return the File selected or created.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: removeRecursively
method.description: Deletes a directory and all of its contents, if any. In the event of an error [e.g. trying to delete a directory that contains a file that cannot be removed], some of the contents of the directory may be deleted. It is an error to attempt to delete the root directory of a filesystem.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called on success.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

interface.name: DirectoryEntrySync
interface.description: This interface represents a directory on a file system.

method.name: createReader
method.description: Creates a new DirectoryReaderSync to read EntrySyncs from this DirectorySync.

method.name: getDirectory
method.description: Creates or looks up a directory.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Either an absolute path or a relative path from this DirectoryEntrySync to the directory to be looked up or created. It is an error to attempt to create a directory whose immediate parent does not yet exist.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
• If create and exclusive are both true and the path already exists, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is true, the path doesn't exist, and no other error occurs, getDirectory must create and return a corresponding DirectoryEntry.
  • If create is not true and the path doesn't exist, getDirectory must fail.
  • If create is not true and the path exists, but is a file, getDirectory must fail.
  • Otherwise, if no other error occurs, getDirectory must return a DirectoryEntrySync corresponding to path.

method.name: getFile
method.description: Creates or looks up a file.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Either an absolute path or a relative path from this DirectoryEntrySync to the file to be looked up or created. It is an error to attempt to create a file whose immediate parent does not yet exist.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
• If create and exclusive are both true and the path already exists, getFile must fail.
  • If create is true, the path doesn't exist, and no other error occurs, getFile must create it as a zero-length file and return a corresponding FileEntry.
  • If create is not true and the path doesn't exist, getFile must fail.
  • If create is not true and the path exists, but is a directory, getFile must fail.
  • Otherwise, if no other error occurs, getFile must return a FileEntrySync corresponding to path.

method.name: removeRecursively
method.description: Deletes a directory and all of its contents, if any. In the event of an error [e.g. trying to delete a directory that contains a file that cannot be removed], some of the contents of the directory may be deleted. It is an error to attempt to delete the root directory of a filesystem.

interface.name: DirectoryReader
interface.description: This interface lets a user list files and directories in a directory.

method.name: readEntries
method.description: Read the next block of entries from this directory.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: Called once per successful call to readEntries to deliver the next previously-unreported set of Entries in the associated Directory. If all Entries have already been returned from previous invocations of readEntries, successCallback must be called with a zero-length array as an argument.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback indicating that there was an error reading from the Directory.

interface.name: DirectoryReaderSync
interface.description: This interface lets a user list files and directories in a directory.

method.name: readEntries
method.description: Read the next block of entries from this directory.

interface.name: EntriesCallback
interface.description: When readEntries() succeeds, this callback is made.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: Used to supply an array of Entries as a response to a user query.

parameter.name: entries
parameter.description: An array of Entries as a response to a user query.

interface.name: Entry
interface.description: An abstract interface representing entries in a file system, each of which may be a File or DirectoryEntry.

method.name: copyTo
method.description: Copy an Entry to a different location on the file system.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.description: The directory to which to move the Entry.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: The new name of the Entry. Defaults to the Entry's current name if unspecified.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called with the Entry for the new object.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: getMetadata
method.description: Look up metadata about this Entry.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called with the time of the last modification.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: getParent
method.description: Look up the parent DirectoryEntry containing this Entry. If this Entry is the root of its filesystem, its parent is itself.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called to return the parent Entry.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: moveTo
method.description: Move an Entry to a different location on the file system.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.description: The directory to which to move the Entry.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: The new name of the Entry. Defaults to the Entry's current name if unspecified.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called with the Entry for the new location.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: remove
method.description: Deletes a file or directory.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called on success.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: toURL
method.description: Returns a URL that can be used to identify this Entry.

property.name: filesystem
property.description: The file system on which the Entry resides.

property.name: fullPath
property.description: The full absolute path from the root to the Entry.

property.name: isDirectory
property.description: True if the Entry is a directory.

property.name: isFile
property.description: True if the Entry is a file.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the Entry, excluding the path leading to it.

interface.name: EntryCallback
interface.description: This interface is the callback used to look up Entry objects.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: Used to supply an Entry as a response to a user query.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.description: The Entry to supply as a response to a user query.

interface.name: EntrySync
interface.description: An abstract interface representing entries in a file system, each of which may be a File or DirectoryEntry.

method.name: copyTo
method.description: Copy an EntrySync to a different location on the file system.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.description: The directory to which to move the EntrySync.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: The new name of the EntrySync. Defaults to the EntrySync's current name if unspecified.

method.name: getMetadata
method.description: Look up metadata about this EntrySync.

method.name: getParent
method.description: Look up the parent DirectoryEntrySync containing this EntrySync. If this EntrySync is the root of its filesystem, its parent is itself.

method.name: moveTo
method.description: Move an EntrySync to a different location on the file system.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.description: The directory to which to move the EntrySync.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: The new name of the EntrySync. Defaults to the EntrySync's current name if unspecified.

method.name: remove
method.description: Deletes a file or directory.

method.name: toURL
method.description: Returns a URL that can be used to identify this EntrySync.

property.name: filesystem
property.description: The file system on which the EntrySync resides.

property.name: fullPath
property.description: The full absolute path from the root to the EntrySync.

property.name: isDirectory
property.description: True if the EntrySync is a directory.

property.name: isFile
property.description: True if the EntrySync is a file.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the EntrySync, excluding the path leading to it.

interface.name: ErrorCallback
interface.description: When an error occurs, this callback is made.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: There was an error with the request. Details are provided by the err parameter.

parameter.name: err

interface.name: FileCallback
interface.description: This interface is the callback used to obtain a File.

method.name: handleEvent

parameter.name: file
parameter.description: A File as a response to a user query.

interface.name: FileEntry
interface.description: This interface represents a file on a file system.

method.name: createWriter

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called with the new FileWriter.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen.

method.name: file
method.description: Returns a File that represents the current state of the file that this FileEntry represents.

parameter.name: errorCallback

interface.name: FileEntrySync
interface.description: This interface represents a file on a file system.

method.name: file

interface.name: FileSystem
interface.description: In the File System API, a FileSystem object represents a file system. The object is the argument of a successful callback of requestFileSystem().

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the file system. The specifics of naming filesystems is unspecified, but a name must be unique across the list of exposed file systems.

property.name: root
property.description: The root directory of the file system.

interface.name: FileSystemCallback
interface.description: When requestFileSystem() succeeds, this callback is made.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: The file system was successfully obtained.

parameter.name: filesystem
parameter.description: The file systems to which the app is granted access.

interface.name: FileSystemSync
interface.description: In the File System API, a FileSystemSync object represents a file system.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the file system. The specifics of naming filesystems is unspecified, but a name must be unique across the list of exposed file systems.

property.name: root
property.description: The root directory of the file system.

interface.name: FileWriterCallback
interface.description: This interface is the callback used to create a FileWriter.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: Used to supply a FileWriter as a response to a user query.

parameter.name: fileWriter
parameter.description: A FileWriter as a response to a user query.

interface.name: LocalFileSystem
interface.description: The LocalFileSystem interface of the File System API gives you access to a sandboxed file system. The methods are implemented by window and worker objects.

method.name: requestFileSystem
method.description: Requests a file system where data should be stored. You access a sandboxed file system by requesting a LocalFileSystem object using this global method, window.requestFileSystem().

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Whether the filesystem requested should be persistent. Use one of TEMPORARY (0) or PERSISTENT (1).

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: How much storage space, in bytes, the application expects to need.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: The callback that is called when the user agent provides a filesystem.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: The callback that is called when errors happen, or when the request to obtain the filesystem is denied.

method.name: resolveLocalFileSystemURL
method.description: Allows the user to look up the Entry for a file or directory referred to by a local URL.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: A URL referring to a local file in a filesystem accessable via this API.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called to report the Entry to which the supplied URL refers.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback that is called when errors happen, or when the request to obtain the Entry is denied.

interface.name: LocalFileSystemSync
interface.description: The LocalFileSystemSync interface of the File System API gives you access to a sandboxed file system. It is intended to be used with WebWorkers. The methods are implemented by worker objects.

method.name: requestFileSystemSync
method.description: Requests a file system where data should be stored. You access a sandboxed file system by requesting a LocalFileSystemSync object from within a web worker using this global method, window.requestFileSystemSync().

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Whether the filesystem requested should be persistent. Use one of TEMPORARY (0) or PERSISTENT (1).

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: How much storage space, in bytes, the application expects to need.

method.name: resolveLocalFileSystemSyncURL
method.description: Allows the user to look up the Entry for a file or directory referred to by a local URL.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: A URL referring to a local file in a filesystem accessable via this API.

interface.name: MetadataCallback
interface.description: This interface is the callback used to look up file and directory metadata.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: Used to supply file or directory metadata as a response to a user query.

parameter.name: metadata
parameter.description: File or directory metadata as a response to a user query.

interface.name: VoidCallback
interface.description: This interface is the generic callback used to indicate success of an asynchronous method.

method.name: handleEvent
method.description: Indicates success of an asynchronous method.

interface.name: Gamepad
interface.description: This object defines an individual gamepad device. Data is retrieved via the DOM Navigator object's getGamepads() method.

property.name: axes
property.description: Array of values for all axes of the gamepad.

property.name: buttons
property.description: Array of values for all buttons of the gamepad.

property.name: id
property.description: A string that identifies the brand or style of connected gamepad device.

property.name: index
property.description: The index of the gamepad in the Navigator.

property.name: timestamp
property.description: A timestamp indicating the last time the data for this gamepad was updated.

interface.name: GamepadEvent
interface.description: This object provides access to event data for this gamepad.

property.name: gamepad
property.description: Provides access to the associated gamepad data for this event.

interface.name: Coordinates
interface.description: The geographic coordinate reference system used by the attributes in this interface is the World Geodetic System (2d).

property.name: accuracy
property.description: Denotes the accuracy level of the latitude and longitude coordinates. It is specified in meters and must be supported by all implementations. The value of this attribute must be a non-negative real number.

property.name: alititudeAccuracy
property.description: Denotes the accuracy level of the altitude coordinate, specified in meters. If the implementation cannot provide altitude information, the value of this attribute must be null.

property.name: altitude
property.description: Denotes the height of the position, specified in meters above the ellipsoid. If the implementation cannot provide altitude information, the value of this attribute must be null.

property.name: heading
property.description: Denotes the direction of travel of the hosting device specified in degrees, where 0° ≤ heading < 360°, counting clockwise relative to the true north. If the implementation cannot provide heading information, the value of this attribute must be null. If the hosting device is stationary (i.e., the value of the speed attribute is 0), then the value of this attribute must be NaN.

property.name: latitude
property.description: Geographic latitude specified in decimal degrees.

property.name: longitude
property.description: Geographic longitude specified in decimal degrees.

property.name: speed
property.description: Denotes the magnitude of the horizontal component of the hosting device's current velocity specified in meters per second. If the implementation cannot provide speed information, the value of this attribute must be null. Otherwise, the value of this attribute must be a non-negative real number.

interface.name: Geolocation
interface.description: The Geolocation object is used by scripts to programmatically determine the location information associated with the hosting device. The location information is acquired by applying a user-agent specific algorithm, creating a Position object, and populating that object with appropriate data accordingly.

method.name: clearWatch
method.description: Stops a specific watch process.

parameter.name: watchId
parameter.description: The ID of the watch operation to cancel. This value is returned by the watchPosition method.

method.name: getCurrentPosition
method.description: Obtains the current location of the device.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: The function to call when geographic position is successfully obtained. The function specified by the successCallback parameter takes one position parameter.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description:
The function to call when the method fails. The function specified by the errorCallback parameter takes one positionError parameter.

To use the options parameter without using the errorCallback parameter, set the errorCallback parameter to null.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: JSON encoding

method.name: watchPosition
method.description: Returns a long value that uniquely identifies a watch operation and then asynchronously starts the watch operation.
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: The function to call when geographic position is successfully obtained. The function specified by the successCallback parameter takes one position parameter.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: The function to call when the attempt to obtain geographic position fails. The function specified by the errorCallback parameter takes one positionError parameter. To use the options parameter without using the errorCallback parameter, specify a null value for the errorCallback parameter.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: JSON encoding

interface.name: Position
interface.description: The container for the geolocation information returned by this API.

property.name: coords
property.description: Contains a set of geographic coordinates together with their associated accuracy, as well as a set of other optional attributes such as altitude and speed.

property.name: timestamp
property.description: Represents the time when the Position object was acquired, represented as a DOMTimeStamp.

interface.name: PositionError
interface.description: The container for Position error information returned by this API.

property.name: code
property.description: The error code of the current PositionError.

property.name: message
property.description: The error text of the current PositionError, describing the details of the error encountered. This attribute is primarily intended for debugging and developers should not use it directly in their application user interface.

interface.name: PositionOptions
interface.description: A native script object used by the getCurrentPosition() and watchPosition() methods.

property.name: enableHighAccuracy
property.description: A request from the application to receive the best possible results.

property.name: maximumAge
property.description: Indicates that the application is willing to accept a cached position whose age is no greater than the specified time (in milliseconds).

property.name: timeout
property.description: Denotes the maximum length of time (expressed in milliseconds) that is allowed to pass from the call to getCurrentPosition() or watchPosition() until the corresponding successCallback is invoked.

interface.name: IDBCursor
