interface.description: Iterates over object stores and indices.

method.name: advance
method.description: Advances the cursor by the specified number.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: A positive, non-zero integer value indicating the number of records to advance.

method.name: continue
method.description: Moves to the next record (or the record specified by a key).
method.return_description: If the steps for synchronously executing a request returns a cursor, then this function returns true. Otherwise this function returns false.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description:
The next key to position this cursor at.

If the key parameter is specified and fulfills any of these conditions this method must throw a DOMException of type DataError:

  • The parameter is not a valid key.
  • The parameter is less than or equal to this cursor's position and this cursor's direction is "next" or "nextunique".
  • The parameter is greater than or equal to this cursor's position and this cursor's direction is "prev" or "prevunique".

method.name: delete
method.description: Returns an IDBRequest object and, in a separate thread, deletes the record at the cursor's position, without changing the cursor's position. Once the record is deleted, the cursor's value is set to null.

method.name: update
method.description: Creates a structured clone of the value parameter.
method.return_description:
IDBRequest

An object representing the update request.

property.name: direction
property.description: Indicates the direction of travel within a cursor.

property.name: key
property.description: The key value for the record currently displayed by the cursor.

property.name: primaryKey
property.description: Returns the cursor's current effective key.

property.name: source
property.description: On getting, returns the IDBObjectStore or IDBIndex that the cursor is iterating. This function never returns null or throws an exception, even if the cursor is currently being iterated, has iterated past its end, or its transaction is not active.

interface.name: IDBCursorWithValue
interface.description: Returns the IDBCursor's value.

interface.name: IDBDatabase
interface.description: Represents a database connection for the purpose of conducting a transaction.

method.name: close
method.description: This method synchronously performs the steps for closing a database connection and returns once the database has been closed.

method.name: createObjectStore
method.description: The createObjectStore method enables you to create object stores inside an indexedDB database. The creation of an object store is only possible inside an "versionchange" transaction.
method.return_description:
IDBObjectStore

An object representing the new object store.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the object store to be created.

parameter.name: optionalParameters
parameter.description:
An object literal containing one or more of the following attributes:

  • keyPath: specifies the key path of the new object store. If the attribute is null, no key path is specified. In this case the key isn't an attribute of the object stored in the value
  • autoIncrement: specifies whether the object store should have a key generator. If a key generator is present, the key will be automatically incremented when objects get inserted.

method.name: deleteObjectStore
method.description: Destroys an object store with the given name as well as all indexes that are referencing that object store.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the object store to be removed.

method.name: setVersion
method.description: Deletion candidate. Not in spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/
method.return_description:
Type: HRESULT

This method can return one of these values.

{

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: The new version identifier.

parameter.name: retVal
parameter.description: The transaction associated with the VERSION_CHANGE request.

method.name: transaction
method.description: Execute the steps for creating a transaction in a sychronous fashion.

parameter.name: storeNames
parameter.description: If specified, defines the names of the object stores included in the transaction. Use a DOMString to specify a single object store or an array of DOMString values to specify multiple object stores.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Value

Meaning

readonly

Changes are not allowed in this transaction.

readwrite

Changes are allowed in this transaction.

versionchange

Objects in the database can be create

property.name: name
property.description: Name of the connected database.

property.name: objectStoreNames
property.description: Returns a list of names of the object stores currently in the connected database.

property.name: version
property.description: Returns the version of the database when this IDBDatabaseSync instance was created.

interface.name: IDBDatabaseException
interface.description: Not supported.

property.name: code
property.description: Not supported.

property.name: message
property.description: Not supported.

interface.name: IDBFactory
interface.description: The object type for the indexedDB property, which provides access to the IndexedDB features supported by the browser and/or device.

method.name: cmp
method.description:
The method compares two specified keys.

The method returns 1 if the first key is greater than the second, -1 if the first is less than the second, and 0 if the first is equal to the second.
method.return_description:
The method returns 1 if the first key is greater than the second, -1 if the first is less than the second, and 0 if the first is equal to the second.

Throws a DOMException (Data Error) is one of the supplied keys was not a valid key.

parameter.name: first
parameter.description: The first key to compare

parameter.name: second
parameter.description: The second key to compare

method.name: deleteDatabase
method.description: Deletes a database with the specified name
method.return_description:
IDBOpenRequest

A IDBOpenRequest request object that fires events to indicate the result of the request.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the database to delete.

method.name: open
method.description: The open method is used to open an IndexedDB database.
method.return_description:
IDBOpenRequest

A IDBOpenRequest request object that fires events to indicate the result of the request.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the database to be opened.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: The version (unsigned long long) for the database

interface.name: IDBIndex
interface.description: A metadata index to a referenced object store.

method.name: count
method.description: Runs the steps for asynchronously executing a request and returns the IDBRequest created by these steps.

method.name: get
method.description: Runs the steps for asynchronously executing a request and returns the IDBRequest created by these steps.

method.name: openCursor
method.description: Creates a cursor.

method.name: openKeyCursor
method.description: Creates a cursor.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: A key range limiting the cursor to a specific set of values.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.description: Indicates the direction of traversal and whether duplicate values are included.

property.name: keyPath
property.description: The key path of this index. If null, this index is not auto-populated.

property.name: multiEntry
property.description: Affects how the index behaves when the result of evaluating the index's key path yields an array. If true, there is one record in the index for each item in an array of keys. If false, then there is one record for each key that is an array.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of this index.

property.name: objectStore
property.description: Returns a reference to the IDBObjectStore instance for the referenced object store in this IDBIndex's transaction.

property.name: unique
property.description: Provides the unique flag of this index.

interface.name: IDBKeyRange
interface.description: A range of keys defined for an object store or index.

method.name: bound
method.description: Creates and returns a new key range with lower set to lower, lowerOpen set to lowerOpen, upper set to upper and upperOpen set to upperOpen.
method.return_description: A range that can be used for specifying the range of cursors.

parameter.name: lower
parameter.description: The lower value of the key range.

parameter.name: upper
parameter.description: The upper value of the key range.

parameter.name: lowerOpen
parameter.description: Indicates whether the key range includes the lower value.

parameter.name: upperOpen
parameter.description: Indicates whether the key range includes the upper value.

method.name: lowerBound
method.description: Creates and returns a new key range with lower set to lower, lowerOpen set to open, upper set to undefined and and upperOpen set to true.

parameter.name: bound
parameter.description: The lower value of the key range.

parameter.name: open
parameter.description: Indicates whether the key range includes the bound value.

method.name: only
method.description: Creates and returns a new key range with both lower and upper set to value and both lowerOpen and upperOpen set to false.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value for the key range.

method.name: upperBound
method.description: Creates and returns a new key range with lower set to undefined, lowerOpen set to true, upper set to upper and and upperOpen set to open.

parameter.name: bound
parameter.description: The upper value of the key range.

parameter.name: open
parameter.description: Indicates whether the key range includes the bound value.

property.name: lower
property.description: This value is the lower-bound of the key range.

property.name: lowerOpen
property.description: Returns false if the lower-bound value is included in the key range. Returns true if the lower-bound value is excluded from the key range.

property.name: upperOpen
property.description: Returns false if the upper-bound value is included in the key range. Returns true if the upper-bound value is excluded from the key range.

interface.name: IDBObjectStore
interface.description: Represents an object store in a database.

method.name: add
method.description: Adds a record to the specified object store.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value must be valid for the Structured Cloning Algorithm.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: A key must be provided if the Object Store does not have a key path, or a key generator is not specified.

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes all records from the object store.

method.name: count
method.description: The count method returns the number of records in an object store.
method.return_description:
IDBRequest

The number of records matching the specified value or "0" if no matches are found.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: A key value or a reference to a IDBKeyRange object.

method.name: createIndex
method.description: This method creates and returns a new index with the given name and parameters in the connected database.
method.return_description:
IDBIndex

An object representing the new index.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the index.

parameter.name: keyPath
parameter.description: Name of the field to be indexed.

parameter.name: optionalParameters
parameter.description: The options object whose attributes are optional parameters to this function. 'unique' specifies whether the index's unique flag is set. 'multiEntry' specifies whether the index's multiEntry flag is set.

method.name: delete
method.description: Removes a record from the specified Object Store.
method.return_description: Returns an IDBRequest Object

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Key identifying the record to be deleted

method.name: deleteIndex
method.description: This method destroys the index with the given name in the connected database. Note that this method must only be called from a "versionchange" transaction callback.

parameter.name: indexName
parameter.description: Name of the index to be deleted.

method.name: get
method.description: Runs the steps for asynchronously executing a request and returns the IDBRequest created by these steps.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key value of the record to be retrieved.

method.name: index
method.description: Returns an IDBIndex representing an index that is part of the object store.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the index to be retrieved.

method.name: openCursor
method.description: Creates a cursor.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: A key range limiting the cursor to a specific set of values.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.description: Indicates the direction of traversal and whether duplicate values are included.

method.name: put
method.description: Creates a structured clone of the value parameter.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: An object literal containing the values to be stored in the object store.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key value of the new record.

property.name: autoIncrement
property.description: Provides the auto increment flag for this object store.

property.name: indexNames
property.description: Provides a list of the names of indexes on objects in this object store.

property.name: keyPath
property.description: Provides the key path of this object store.

property.name: name
property.description: Provides the name of this object store.

property.name: transaction
property.description: Returns the transaction this object store belongs to.

interface.name: IDBOpenDBRequest
interface.description: Provides access to the result of a request to open a database.

property.name: onUpgradeNeeded
property.description: The event handler for the upgrade needed event.

property.name: onblocked
property.description: The event handler for the blocked event. This event is triggered when the upgradeneeded should be triggered because of a version change but the database is still in use (ie not closed) somewhere, even after the versionchange event was sent.

interface.name: IDBRequest
interface.description: Provides access to the result of a request on the database.

property.name: error
property.description: The error codes returned under certain conditions.

property.name: onerror
property.description: The event handler for the error event.

property.name: onsuccess
property.description: The event handler for the success event.

property.name: readyState
property.description: The state of the request. Every request starts in the pending state. The state changes to done when the request completes successfully or when an error occurs.

property.name: result
property.description: Returns the result of the request. If the the request failed and the result is not available, the DOMException InvalidStateError exception is thrown.

property.name: source
property.description: The source of the request, such as an Index or a ObjectStore. If no source exists (such as when calling indexedDB.open()), it returns null.

property.name: transaction
property.description: The transaction for the request. This property can be null for certain requests, such as for request returned from IDBFactory.open (You're just connecting to a database, so there is no transaction to return).

interface.name: IDBTransaction
interface.description: Provides for the scope and type of access to a database, and represents a transaction on the database.

method.name: abort
method.description: The abort method is used to abort a transaction. Once called, the abort method follows the [http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/#dfn-steps-for-aborting-a-transaction steps to abort] a transaction

method.name: objectStore
method.description: Returns an object store that has already been added to the scope of this transaction.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of the object store to return.

property.name: db
property.description: The database connection of which this transaction is a part.

property.name: error
property.description: Null if the transaction is not finished, is finished and successfully committed, or was aborted with the abort() function. Returns the same DOMError as the request object which caused the transaction to be aborted due to a failed request, or a DOMError for the transaction failure not due to a failed request (such as QuotaExceededError or UnknownError).

property.name: mode
property.description: The mode for isolating access to data in the object stores that are in the scope of the transaction. For possible values, see Return Value, below. The default value is readonly.

property.name: onabort
property.description: The event handler for the onabort event.

property.name: oncomplete
property.description: The event handler for the oncomplete event.

property.name: onerror
property.description: The event handler for the error event.

interface.name: IDBVersionChangeEvent
interface.description: The IDBVersionChangeEvent object represents the event object passed to the upgradeneeded event, which fires when a database is opened using a higher version number.

property.name: newVersion
property.description: Returns the new version of the database, which is the version specified by the open request.

property.name: oldVersion
property.description: Returns the old version of the database.

interface.name: IDBVersionChangeRequest
interface.description: Deprecated. Previously used to change the version of the database.

property.name: onblocked
property.description: The event handler for the blocked event.

interface.name: IndexedDB
interface.description: Implements the IDBFactory object's open method, thereby providing the way to open (create or access) a database.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens a database. See [[apis/indexeddb/IDBFactory/open]]

interface.name: Intl
interface.description:
Intl object serves as a namespace for the i18n API.

The Intl object is a standard built-in object that is the initial value of the Intl property of the global object.

It is not possible to use the Intl object as a constructor with the new operator.

It is not possible to invoke the Intl object as a function.

interface.name: Json
interface.description:
JSON is a native API for parsing and serialising information to the JSON format.

JSON contains two methods: parse for parsing JSON strings, and stringify for converting a JavaScript object into JSON.

interface.name: Location
interface.description: The location object provides access to the address related properties of the current document.

method.name: assign
method.description: Navigate to a new page.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The new url to navigate to.

method.name: reload
method.description: Refresh/reload the current page, optionally forcing a re-download of the content.

parameter.name: forceget
parameter.description: Boolean, true forces a download the page contents again.

method.name: replace
method.description: Similar to window.location.assign, except that it "replaces" the current document, removing the previous one from the back button history.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The new url to navigate to.

property.name: hash
property.description: The hash property contains the fragment identifier (including hash character) for the current page.

property.name: host
property.description: The host property contains the host part of the the current document URL, (hostname:port).

property.name: hostname
property.description: The hostname property contains the hostname the current document was served from, excluding protocol, port, and other information.

property.name: href
property.description: The full url for this resource. Synonymous with String(window.location).

property.name: pathname
property.description: The path to the current document, relative to the root of the current host.

property.name: port
property.description: The port number the document was accessed via.

property.name: protocol
property.description:
Sets or retrieves the protocol portion of a URL.

The protocol the current document was accessed via (everything preceding the "//").

property.name: search
property.description: The search property contains the query string portion of the current url.

interface.name: Performance
interface.description: The HTML5 specification defines a Window interface, which this specification extends.

property.name: navigation
property.description: This attribute is defined by the PerformanceNavigation interface.

property.name: timing
property.description: Represents the timing information related to the browsing contexts since the last non-redirect navigation. This attribute is defined by the PerformanceTiming interface.

interface.name: PerformanceNavigation
interface.description: An interface that provides Web applications with navigation-related information.

property.name: redirectCount
property.description: Returns the number of redirects since the last non-redirect navigation under the current browsing context. If there is no redirect or there is any redirect that is not from the same origin as the destination document, returns zero.

property.name: type
property.description: Returns the type of the last non-redirect navigation in the current browsing context. See Notes.

interface.name: PerformanceTiming
interface.description: An interface that provides Web applications with timing-related information.

property.name: connectEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the current document.

property.name: connectStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent start establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the document.

property.name: domComplete
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent sets the current document readiness to "complete".

property.name: domContentLoadedEventStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent fires the DOMContentLoaded event at the Document.

property.name: domInteractive
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent sets the current document readiness to "interactive".

property.name: domLoading
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent sets the current document readiness to "loading".

property.name: domainLookupEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes the domain name lookup for the current document.

property.name: domainLookupStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts the domain name lookup for the current document.

property.name: fetchStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts checking any relevant application caches (if the resource is to be fetched using HTTP GET or equivalent). Otherwise, returns the time when the user agent starts fetching the resource.

property.name: loadEventEnd
property.description: Returns the time when the load event of the current document is completed, or returns zero when the load event is not fired or is not completed.

property.name: loadEventStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the load event of the current document is fired, or returns zero when the load event is not fired yet.

property.name: navigationStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes prompting to unload the previous document. If there is no previous document, returns the same value as fetchStart.

property.name: redirectEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after receiving the last byte of the response of the last redirect, if there are HTTP redirects or equivalent when navigating and all redirects and equivalents are from the same origin. Otherwise, returns zero.

property.name: redirectStart
property.description: Returns the starting time of the fetch that initiates the redirect, if there are HTTP redirects or equivalent when navigating and if all the redirects or equivalent are from the same origin,. Otherwise, returns zero.

property.name: requestStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts requesting the current document from the server, or from relevant application caches or from local resources. If the transport connection fails after a request is sent and the user agent reopens a connection and resends the request, returns the corresponding values of the new request.

property.name: responseEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent receives the last byte of the current document from the server, relevant application caches or from local resources, or immediately before the transport connection is closed, whichever comes first.

property.name: responseStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent receives the first byte of the response from the server, or from relevant application caches or from local resources.

property.name: secureConnectionStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts the handshake process to secure the current connection, if the scheme of the current page is HTTPS. If HTTPS is not used, returns zero.

property.name: unloadEventEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes the unload event of the previous document. If there is no previous document or the previous document has a different origin than the current document or the unload is not yet completed, returns zero.

property.name: unloadEventStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts the unload event of the previous document. If there is no previous document or the previous document has a different origin than the current document, returns zero.

property.name: domContentLoadedEventEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the document's DOMContentLoaded event completes.

property.name: msFirstPaint
property.description: Deletion candidate.

interface.name: StorageQuota
interface.description: Provides a means to query and request storage usage and quota information.

method.name: queryUsageAndQuota
method.description: Queries the current usage (how much data is stored) and quota available for the requesting application.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description:
This callback is used to return new quota information granted by a User Agent. Quota is provided by the grantedQuotaInBytes parameter.

void (unsigned long grantedQuotaInBytes)

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description:
This callback is used to return information when an error has occured. Details are provided by the error parameter.

void (DOMError error)

method.name: requestQuota
method.description: Requests a new quota for the requesting application.

parameter.name: newQuotaInBytes
parameter.description: The requested new quota, expressed in bytes.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description:
This callback is used to return new quota information granted by a User Agent. Quota is provided by the grantedQuotaInBytes parameter.

void (unsigned long grantedQuotaInBytes)

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description:
This callback is used to return information when an error has occured. Details are provided by the error parameter.

void (DOMError error)

interface.name: Performance
interface.description: Provides methods for performance timing.

method.name: clearResourceTimings
method.description: Clears the buffer used to store the current list of PerformanceResourceTiming resources.

method.name: setResourceTimingBufferSize
method.description: Sets the maximum number of PerformanceResourceTiming resources that may be stored in the buffer to the value of the maxSize parameter.

parameter.name: maxSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of PerformanceResourceTiming resources that will be stored in the buffer.

property.name: onresourcetimingbufferfull
property.description: This callback is triggered when the buffer used to store the list of PerformanceResourceTiming is full.

interface.name: PerformanceResourceTiming
interface.description: Includes all resources fetched from the networking layer by the current browsing context.

property.name: connectEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource.

property.name: connectStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource.

property.name: domainLookupEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes the domain name lookup for the resource.

property.name: domainLookupStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts the domain name lookup for the resource.

property.name: fetchStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts to fetch the resource.

property.name: initiatorType
property.description: Returns a DOMString representing the type of object that initiated the request for the resource. See Return Value.

property.name: redirectEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after receiving the last byte of the response of the last redirect.

property.name: redirectStart
property.description: Returns the starting time of the fetch that initiates the redirect.

property.name: requestStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts requesting the resource from the server, or from relevant application caches or from local resources.

property.name: responseEnd
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent finishes receiving the last byte of the resource from from relevant application caches or from local resources.

property.name: responseStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately after the user agent receives the first byte of the response from the server, or from relevant application caches or from local resources.

property.name: secureConnectionStart
property.description: Returns the time immediately before the user agent starts the handshake process to secure the current connection.

interface.name: Performance
interface.description: Exposes a high precision timestamp to developers so they can better measure the performance of their applications.

method.name: clearMarks
method.description: Removes all DOMHighResTimeStamp time values for the given mark name, or removes all marks and their associated DOMHighResTimeStamp time values.

parameter.name: markName
parameter.description: Name of the mark(s) to be cleared.

method.name: clearMeasures
method.description: Removes all DOMHighResTimeStamp durations for the given measure name, or removes all measures and their associated DOMHighResTimeStamp durations.

parameter.name: measureName
parameter.description: Name of the measures(s) to be cleared.

method.name: mark
method.description: Stores a timestamp with the associated name (a "mark").

parameter.name: markName
parameter.description: Name associated with the performance mark.

method.name: measure
method.description: Stores the DOMHighResTimeStamp duration between two marks along with the associated name (a "measure").

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name associated with the performance measure.

parameter.name: startMark
parameter.description: Name of the start performance mark.

parameter.name: endMark
parameter.description: Name of the end performance mark.

interface.name: PerformanceMark
interface.description: Exposes marks created via the mark() method to the Performance Timeline.

property.name: duration
property.description: Returns a DOMHighResTimeStamp of value 0.

property.name: entryType
property.description: Returns the DOMString mark.

property.name: name
property.description: Returns the mark's name.

property.name: startTime
property.description: Returns a DOMHighResTimeStamp with the mark's High Resolution Time time value.

interface.name: PerformanceMeasure
interface.description: Exposes measures created via the measure() method to the Performance Timeline.

property.name: duration
property.description: Returns a DOMHighResTimeStamp with the duration of the measure.

property.name: entryType
property.description: Returns the DOMString measure.

property.name: name
property.description: Returns the measure's name.

property.name: startTime
property.description: Returns a DOMHighResTimeStamp with the measure's High Resolution Time start mark.

interface.name: MessageChannel
interface.description: Creates a connection (two "entangled" ports) to enable independent pieces of code (running in different browsing contexts) to communicate directly.

property.name: port1
property.description: Returns the first MessagePort object.

property.name: port2
property.description: Returns the second MessagePort object.

interface.name: MessagePort
interface.description: Exposes the available methods on the connected ports.

method.name: close
method.description: Disconnects the port, so that it is no longer active.

method.name: postMessage
method.description: Posts a message through the channel, from one port to the other.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description: JavaScript primitive, such as a string, PixelArray, ImageData, Blob, File, or ArrayBuffer.

parameter.name: transfer
parameter.description:
Objects listed in transfer are transferred, not just cloned, meaning that they are no longer usable on the sending side.

Throws a DataCloneError if transfer array contains duplicate objects or the source or target ports, or if message could not be cloned.

method.name: start
method.description: Begins dispatching messages received on the port.

interface.name: Storage
interface.description: Provides access to a list of key/value pairs, sometimes called "items".

method.name: clear
method.description: Causes the list associated with the object to be emptied of all key/value pairs, if there are any.

method.name: getItem
method.description: Returns the current value associated with the given key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of the key (a valid UTF-16 string, including the empty string).

method.name: key
method.description: Returns the name of the nth key in the list.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: A zero-based index of the list entry, up to the length of the collection.

method.name: removeItem
method.description: Removes the key/value pair with the given key from the list associated with the object, if it exists.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of the key, or the empty string.

method.name: setItem
method.description: Adds or replaces a value for the given key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of the key (a valid UTF-16 string, including the empty string).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value (a valid UTF-16 string) for the key/value pair.

property.name: length
property.description: Returns the number of key/value pairs currently present in the list associated with the object.

property.name: localStorage
property.description: Provides a Storage object for an origin.

property.name: sessionStorage
property.description: Provides a Storage object specific to the current top-level browsing context.

interface.name: AnalyserNode
interface.description: This interface represents a node which is able to provide real-time frequency and time-domain analysis information. The audio stream will be passed un-processed from input to output.

method.name: getByteFrequencyData
method.description: Copies the current frequency data into the passed unsigned byte array. If the array has fewer elements than the frequencyBinCount, the excess elements will be dropped.

parameter.name: array
parameter.description: Where frequency-domain analysis data will be copied.

method.name: getByteTimeDomainData
method.description: Copies the current time-domain (waveform) data into the passed unsigned byte array. If the array has fewer elements than the frequencyBinCount, the excess elements will be dropped.

parameter.name: array
parameter.description: Were time-domain analysis data will be copied.

method.name: getFloatFrequencyData
method.description: Copies the current frequency data into the passed floating-point array. If the array has fewer elements than the frequencyBinCount, the excess elements will be dropped.

parameter.name: array
parameter.description: Where frequency-domain analysis data will be copied.

property.name: fftSize
property.description: The size of the FFT used for frequency-domain analysis. This must be a power of two.

property.name: frequencyBinCount
property.description: Half the fftSize (the size of the FFT used for frequency-domain analysis).

property.name: maxDecibels
property.description: The maximum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data for conversion to unsigned byte values.

property.name: minDecibels
property.description: The minimum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data for conversion to unsigned byte values.

property.name: smoothingTimeConstant
property.description: A value from 0 to 1 where 0 represents no time averaging with the last analysis frame.

interface.name: AudioBuffer
interface.description: This interface represents a memory-resident audio asset, primarily for one-shot sounds and other short audio clips. Its format is non-interleaved IEEE 32-bit linear PCM with a nominal range of -1 -> +1. It can contain one or more channels.

method.name: getChannelData
method.description: Returns the Float32Array representing the PCM audio data for the specific channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: The channel parameter is an index representing the particular channel to get data for. An index value of 0 represents the first channel. This index value MUST be less than numberOfChannels or an exception will be thrown.

property.name: duration
property.description: Duration of the PCM audio data in seconds.

property.name: length
property.description: Length of the PCM audio data in sample-frames.

property.name: numberOfChannels
property.description: The number of discrete audio channels.

property.name: sampleRate
property.description: The sample-rate for the PCM audio data in samples per second.

interface.name: AudioBufferSourceNode
interface.description: This interface represents an audio source from an in-memory audio asset in an AudioBuffer. It generally will be used for short audio assets which require a high degree of scheduling flexibility (can playback in rhythmically perfect ways).

method.name: start
method.description: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.

parameter.name: when
parameter.description: Describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should start playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will start playing immediately. start may only be called one time and must be called before stop is called or an exception will be thrown.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: Describes the offset time in the buffer (in seconds) where playback will begin. This parameter is optional with a default value of 0 (playing back from the beginning of the buffer).

parameter.name: duration
parameter.description: Describes the duration of the portion (in seconds) to be played. This parameter is optional, with the default value equal to the total duration of the AudioBuffer minus the offset parameter. Thus if neither offset nor duration are specified then the implied duration is the total duration of the AudioBuffer.

method.name: stop
method.description: Schedules a sound to stop playback at an exact time.

parameter.name: when
parameter.description: Describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should stop playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will stop playing immediately. stop must only be called one time and only after a call to start or stop, or an exception will be thrown.

property.name: buffer
property.description: Represents the audio asset to be played.

property.name: loop
property.description: Indicates if the audio data should play in a loop. The default value is false.

property.name: loopEnd
property.description: An optional value in seconds where looping should end if the loop attribute is true. Its default value is 0, and it may usefully be set to any value between 0 and the duration of the buffer.

property.name: loopStart
property.description: An optional value in seconds where looping should begin if the loop attribute is true. Its default value is 0, and it may usefully be set to any value between 0 and the duration of the buffer.

property.name: playbackRate
property.description: The speed at which to render the audio stream. The default playbackRate value is 1. This parameter is a-rate.

property.name: playbackState
property.description: The playback state, initialized to UNSCHEDULED_STATE, progressing through SCHEDULED_STATE, PLAYING_STATE, and FINISHED_STATE.

interface.name: AudioContext
interface.description: The AudioContext represents a set of AudioNode objects and their connections. It allows for arbitrary routing of signals to the AudioDestinationNode (what the user ultimately hears). Nodes are created from the context and are then connected together. In most use cases, only a single AudioContext is used per document.

method.name: createAnalyser
method.description: Creates an AnalyserNode.

method.name: createBiquadFilter
method.description: Creates a BiquadFilterNode representing a second order filter which can be configured as one of several common filter types.

method.name: createBuffer
method.description: Creates an AudioBuffer of the given size. The audio data in the buffer will be zero-initialized (silent). An exception will be thrown if the numberOfChannels or sampleRate are out-of-bounds.

parameter.name: numberOfChannels
parameter.description: Determines how many channels the buffer will have. An implementation must support at least 32 channels.

parameter.name: length
parameter.description: Determines the size of the buffer in sample-frames.

parameter.name: sampleRate
parameter.description: Describes the sample-rate of the linear PCM audio data in the buffer in sample-frames per second. An implementation must support sample-rates in at least the range 22050 to 96000.

method.name: createBufferSource
method.description: Creates an AudioBufferSourceNode.

method.name: createChannelMerger
method.description: Creates a ChannelMergerNode representing a channel merger. An exception will be thrown for invalid parameter values.
method.return_description: Determines the number of outputs. Values of up to 32 must be supported. If not specified, then 6 will be used.

parameter.name: numberOfOutputs
parameter.description: Determines the number of outputs. Values of up to 32 must be supported. If not specified, then 6 will be used.

method.name: createChannelSplitter
method.description: Creates a ChannelSplitterNode representing a channel splitter. An exception will be thrown for invalid parameter values.

parameter.name: numberOfInputs
parameter.description: Determines the number of inputs. Values of up to 32 must be supported. If not specified, then 6 will be used.

method.name: createConvolver
method.description: Creates a ConvolverNode.

method.name: createDelay
method.description: Creates a DelayNode representing a variable delay line. The initial default delay time will be 0 seconds.

parameter.name: maxDelayTime
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum delay time in seconds allowed for the delay line. If specified, this value must be greater than zero and less than three minutes or a NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR exception will be thrown.

method.name: createDynamicsCompressor
method.description: Creates a DynamicsCompressorNode.

method.name: createGain
method.description: Creates a GainNode.

method.name: createMediaElementSource
method.description: Creates a MediaElementAudioSourceNode given an HTMLMediaElement. As a consequence of calling this method, audio playback from the HTMLMediaElement will be re-routed into the processing graph of the AudioContext.

method.name: createMediaStreamSource
method.description: Creates a MediaStreamAudioSourceNode given a MediaStream. As a consequence of calling this method, audio playback from the MediaStream will be re-routed into the processing graph of the AudioContext.

method.name: createOscillator
method.description: Creates an OscillatorNode.

method.name: createPanner
method.description: Creates a PannerNode.

method.name: createScriptProcessor
method.description: Creates a ScriptProcessorNode for direct audio processing using JavaScript. An exception will be thrown if bufferSize or numberOfInputChannels or numberOfOutputChannels are outside the valid range.

parameter.name: bufferSize
parameter.description: Determines the buffer size in units of sample-frames. It must be one of the following values: 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384. This value controls how frequently the onaudioprocess event handler is called and how many sample-frames need to be processed each call. Lower values for bufferSize will result in a lower (better) latency. Higher values will be necessary to avoid audio breakup and glitches. The value chosen must carefully balance between latency and audio quality.

parameter.name: numberOfInputChannels
parameter.description: Defaults to 2; determines the number of channels for this node's input. Values of up to 32 must be supported.

parameter.name: numberOfOutputChannels
parameter.description: Defaults to 2; determines the number of channels for this node's output. Values of up to 32 must be supported.

method.name: createWaveShaper
method.description: Creates a WaveShaperNode representing a non-linear distortion.

method.name: createWaveTable
method.description: Creates a WaveTable representing a waveform containing arbitrary harmonic content. The real and imag parameters must be of type Float32Array of equal lengths greater than zero and less than or equal to 4096 or an exception will be thrown. These parameters specify the Fourier coefficients of a Fourier series representing the partials of a periodic waveform. The created WaveTable will be used with an OscillatorNode and will represent a normalized time-domain waveform having maximum absolute peak value of 1. Another way of saying this is that the generated waveform of an OscillatorNode will have maximum peak value at 0dBFS. Conveniently, this corresponds to the full-range of the signal values used by the Web Audio API. Because the WaveTable will be normalized on creation, the real and imag parameters represent relative values.

parameter.name: real
parameter.description: Represents an array of cosine terms (traditionally the A terms). In audio terminology, the first element (index 0) is the DC-offset of the periodic waveform and is usually set to zero. The second element (index 1) represents the fundamental frequency. The third element represents the first overtone, and so on.

parameter.name: imag
parameter.description: Represents an array of sine terms (traditionally the B terms). The first element (index 0) should be set to zero (and will be ignored) since this term does not exist in the Fourier series. The second element (index 1) represents the fundamental frequency. The third element represents the first overtone, and so on.

method.name: decodeAudioData
method.description:
Asynchronously decodes the audio file data contained in the [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/JavaScript_typed_arrays/ArrayBuffer ArrayBuffer]. The ArrayBuffer can, for example, be loaded from an XMLHttpRequest with the new responseType and response attributes. Audio file data can be in any of the formats supported by the audio element.

The decodeAudioData() method is preferred over the createBuffer() from ArrayBuffer method because it is asynchronous and does not block the main JavaScript thread.

parameter.name: audioData
parameter.description: An ArrayBuffer containing audio file data.

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description: A callback function which will be invoked when the decoding is finished. The single argument to this callback is an AudioBuffer representing the decoded PCM audio data.

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description: A callback function which will be invoked if there is an error decoding the audio file data.

property.name: activeSourceCount
property.description: The number of AudioBufferSourceNodes that are currently playing.

property.name: currentTime
property.description: This is a time in seconds which starts at zero when the context is created and increases in real-time. All scheduled times are relative to it. This is not a transport time which can be started, paused, and re-positioned. It is always moving forward. A GarageBand-like timeline transport system can be very easily built on top of this (in JavaScript). This time corresponds to an ever-increasing hardware timestamp.

property.name: destination
property.description: An AudioDestinationNode with a single input representing the final destination for all audio (to be rendered to the audio hardware). All AudioNodes actively rendering audio will directly or indirectly connect to destination.

property.name: listener
property.description: An AudioListener which is used for 3D spatialization.

property.name: sampleRate
property.description: The sample rate (in sample-frames per second) at which the AudioContext handles audio. It is assumed that all AudioNodes in the context run at this rate. In making this assumption, sample-rate converters or varispeed processors are not supported in real-time processing.

interface.name: AudioDestinationNode
interface.description: An AudioNode representing the final audio destination and is what the user will ultimately hear. It can be considered as an audio output device which is connected to speakers. All rendered audio to be heard will be routed to this node, a terminal node in the AudioContext's routing graph. There is only a single AudioDestinationNode per AudioContext, provided through the destination attribute of AudioContext.

property.name: maxNumberOfChannels
property.description: The maximum number of channels that the numberOfChannels attribute can be set to; that is, the maximum number of channels that this hardware is capable of supporting. A value of 0 indicates that maxNumberOfChannels may not be changed. This will be the case for an AudioDestinationNode in an OfflineAudioContext.

property.name: numberOfChannels
property.description: The number of channels of the destination's input. This value will default to 2, and may be set to any non-zero value less than or equal to maxNumberOfChannels. An exception will be thrown if this value is not within the valid range.

interface.name: AudioListener
interface.description: This interface represents the position and orientation of the person listening to the audio scene. All PannerNode objects spatialize in relation to the AudioContext's listener.

method.name: setOrientation
method.description: Describes which direction the listener is pointing in the 3D cartesian coordinate space. Both a front vector and an up vector are provided. In simple human terms, the front vector represents which direction the person's nose is pointing. The up vector represents the direction the top of a person's head is pointing. These values are expected to be linearly independent (at right angles to each other). The x, y, z parameters represent a front direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being (0,0,-1). The xUp, yUp, zUp parameters represent an up direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being (0,1,0).

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Sets the position of the listener in a 3D cartesian coordinate space. PannerNode objects use this position relative to individual audio sources for spatialization. The x, y, z parameters represent the coordinates in 3D space. The default value is (0,0,0).

method.name: setVelocity
method.description: Sets the velocity vector of the listener. This vector controls both the direction of travel and the speed in 3D space. This velocity relative an audio source's velocity is used to determine how much doppler shift (pitch change) to apply. The x, y, z parameters describe a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity. The default value is (0,0,0).

property.name: dopplerFactor
property.description: A constant used to determine the amount of pitch shift to use when rendering a doppler effect. The default value is 1.

property.name: speedOfSound
property.description: The speed of sound used for calculating doppler shift. The default value is 343.3 meters / second.

interface.name: AudioNode
interface.description: AudioNodes are the building blocks of an AudioContext. An AudioNode represents audio sources, the audio destination, and intermediate processing modules, connected together to form processing graphs for rendering audio to the audio hardware. In general, an AudioNode processes its inputs (if it has any), and generates audio for its outputs (if it has any).

method.name: connect
method.description: Connects the AudioNode to another AudioNode.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: The AudioNode to connect to.

parameter.name: output
parameter.description: An index describing which output of the AudioNode to connect from. An out-of-bound value throws an exception.

parameter.name: input
parameter.description: An index describing which input of the destination AudioNode to connect to. An out-of-bound value throws an exception.

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Disconnects an AudioNode's output.

parameter.name: output
parameter.description: An index describing which output of the AudioNode to disconnect. An out-of-bound value throws an exception.

property.name: context
property.description: The AudioContext that owns this AudioNode.

property.name: numberOfInputs
property.description: The number of inputs feeding into the AudioNode. This will be 0 for an AudioSourceNode.

property.name: numberOfOutputs
property.description: The number of outputs coming out of the AudioNode. This will be 0 for an AudioDestinationNode.

interface.name: AudioParam
interface.description: AudioParam controls an individual aspect of an AudioNode's functioning, such as volume. The parameter can be set immediately to a particular value using the value attribute. Or, value changes can be scheduled to happen at very precise times (in the coordinate system of AudioContext.currentTime), for envelopes, volume fades, LFOs, filter sweeps, grain windows, etc. In this way, arbitrary timeline-based automation curves can be set on any AudioParam. Additionally, audio signals from the outputs of AudioNodes can be connected to an AudioParam, summing with the intrinsic parameter value.

method.name: cancelScheduledValues
method.description: Cancels all scheduled parameter changes with times greater than or equal to startTime.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: The starting time at and after which any previously scheduled parameter changes will be cancelled. It is a time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

method.name: exponentialRampToValueAtTime
method.description: Schedules an exponential continuous change in parameter value from the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value. Parameters representing filter frequencies and playback rate are best changed exponentially because of the way humans perceive sound.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value the parameter will exponentially ramp to at the given time. An exception will be thrown if this value is less than or equal to 0, or if the value at the time of the previous event is less than or equal to 0.

parameter.name: endTime
parameter.description: The time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

method.name: linearRampToValueAtTime
method.description: Schedules a linear continuous change in parameter value from the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value the parameter will linearly ramp to at the given time.

parameter.name: endTime
parameter.description: The time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

method.name: setTargetAtTime
method.description: Start exponentially approaching the target value at the given time with a rate having the given time constant. Among other uses, this is useful for implementing the decay and release portions of an ADSR envelope. Please note that the parameter value does not immediately change to the target value at the given time, but instead gradually changes to the target value.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The value the parameter will start changing to at the given time.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: The time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

parameter.name: timeConstant
parameter.description: The time-constant value of first-order filter (exponential) approach to the target value. The larger this value is, the slower the transition will be.

method.name: setValueAtTime
method.description: Schedules a parameter value change at the given time.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value the parameter will change to at the given time.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: The time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

method.name: setValueCurveAtTime
method.description: Sets an array of arbitrary parameter values starting at the given time for the given duration. The number of values will be scaled to fit into the desired duration.

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: A Float32Array representing a parameter value curve. These values will apply starting at the given time and lasting for the given duration.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: The time in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.description: The amount of time in seconds (after the time parameter) where values will be calculated according to the values parameter.

property.name: computedValue
property.description: The final value controlling the audio DSP, calculated at each time, which is either the value set directly to the value attribute or, if there are any scheduled parameter changes (automation events), the value as calculated from these events.

property.name: defaultValue
property.description: Initial value for the value attribute.

property.name: maxValue
property.description: Nominal maximum value. The value attribute may be set higher than this value.

property.name: minValue
property.description: Nominal minimum value. The value attribute may be set lower than this value.

property.name: value
property.description: The parameter's floating-point value. If a value is set outside the allowable range described by minValue and maxValue no exception is thrown, because these limits are just nominal and may be exceeded. If a value is set during a time when there are any automation events scheduled then it will be ignored and no exception will be thrown.

interface.name: AudioProcessingEvent
interface.description: This interface is a type of Event which is passed to the onaudioprocess event handler used by ScriptProcessorNode. The event handler processes audio from the input (if any) by accessing the audio data from the inputBuffer attribute. The audio data which is the result of the processing (or the synthesized data if there are no inputs) is then placed into the outputBuffer.

property.name: inputBuffer
property.description: An AudioBuffer containing the input audio data. It will have a number of channels equal to the numberOfInputChannels parameter of the createScriptProcessor() method. This AudioBuffer is only valid while in the scope of the onaudioprocess function. Its values will be meaningless outside of this scope.

property.name: node
property.description: The ScriptProcessorNode associated with this processing event.

property.name: outputBuffer
property.description: An AudioBuffer where the output audio data should be written. It will have a number of channels equal to the numberOfOutputChannels parameter of the createScriptProcessor() method. Script code within the scope of the onaudioprocess function is expected to modify the Float32Array arrays representing channel data in this AudioBuffer. Any script modifications to this AudioBuffer outside of this scope will not produce any audible effects.

property.name: playbackTime
property.description: The time when the audio will be played, in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. playbackTime allows for very tight synchronization between processing directly in JavaScript with the other events in the context's rendering graph.

interface.name: BiquadFilterNode
interface.description: BiquadFilterNode is an AudioNode processor implementing common low-order filters, which are the building blocks of basic tone controls (bass, mid, treble), graphic equalizers, and more advanced filters. Multiple BiquadFilterNode filters can be combined to form more complex filters. Each BiquadFilterNode can be configured as one of a number of common filter types as listed in the type property page, linked below. The default filter type is LOWPASS.

method.name: getFrequencyResponse
method.description: Given the current filter parameter settings, calculates the frequency response for the specified frequencies.

parameter.name: frequencyHz
parameter.description: Specifies an array of frequencies at which the response values will be calculated.

parameter.name: magResponse
parameter.description: Specifies an output array receiving the linear magnitude response values.

parameter.name: phaseResponse
parameter.description: Specifies an output array receiving the phase response values in radians.

property.name: Q
property.description: Used in different ways by the various types. Defaults to 1, with a nominal range of 0.0001 to 1000. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: frequency
property.description: Used in different ways by the various types. Defaults to 350Hz, with a nominal range of 10 to the Nyquist frequency (half the sample-rate). This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: gain
property.description: Used in different ways by the various types. Defaults to 0, with a nominal range of -40 to 40. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of BiquadFilterNode.

interface.name: ChannelMergerNode
interface.description: Represents an AudioNode for combining channels from multiple audio streams into a single audio stream.

interface.name: ChannelSplitterNode
interface.description: Represents an AudioNode for accessing the individual channels of an audio stream in the routing graph.

interface.name: ConvolverNode
interface.description: This interface represents a processing node which applies a linear convolution effect given an impulse response.

property.name: buffer
property.description: A mono, stereo, or 4-channel AudioBuffer containing the (possibly multi-channel) impulse response used by the ConvolverNode. At the time when this attribute is set, the buffer and the state of the normalize attribute will be used to configure the ConvolverNode with this impulse response having the given normalization.

property.name: normalize
property.description: Controls whether the impulse response from the buffer will be scaled by an equal-power normalization when the buffer atttribute is set. Its default value is true in order to achieve a more uniform output level from the convolver when loaded with diverse impulse responses. If normalize is set to false, then the convolution will be rendered with no pre-processing/scaling of the impulse response. Changes to this value do not take effect until the next time the buffer attribute is set. If the normalize attribute is false when the buffer attribute is set then the ConvolverNode will perform a linear convolution given the exact impulse response contained within the buffer.

interface.name: DelayNode
interface.description: A delay-line is a fundamental building block in audio applications. This interface is an AudioNode with a single input and single output, which delays the incoming audio signal by a certain amount. The default amount is 0 seconds (no delay).

property.name: delayTime
property.description: An AudioParam object representing the amount of delay (in seconds) to apply. The default value (delayTime.value) is 0 (no delay). The minimum value is 0 and the maximum value is determined by the maxDelayTime argument to the AudioContext method createDelay. This parameter is k-rate.

interface.name: DynamicsCompressorNode
interface.description: DynamicsCompressorNode is an AudioNode processor implementing a dynamics compression effect, which lowers the volume of the loudest parts of the signal and raises the volume of the softest parts. Compression is especially important in games and musical applications where large numbers of individual sounds are played simultaneously to control the overall signal level and help avoid clipping (distorting) the audio output to the speakers.

property.name: attack
property.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to reduce the gain by 10dB. Its default value is 0.003, with a nominal range of 0 to 1. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: knee
property.description: A decibel value representing the range above the threshold where the curve smoothly transitions to the ratio portion. Its default value is 30, with a nominal range of 0 to 40. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: ratio
property.description: The amount of dB change in input for a 1 dB change in output. Its default value is 12, with a nominal range of 1 to 20. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: reduction
property.description: A read-only decibel value for metering purposes, representing the current amount of gain reduction that the compressor is applying to the signal. If fed no signal the value will be 0 (no gain reduction). The nominal range is -20 to 0. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: release
property.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to increase the gain by 10dB. Its default value is 0.250, with a nominal range of 0 to 1. This parameter is k-rate.

property.name: threshold
property.description: The decibel value above which the compression will start taking effect. Its default value is -24, with a nominal range of -100 to 0. This parameter is k-rate.

interface.name: GainNode
interface.description: Changing the gain of an audio signal is a fundamental operation in audio applications. The GainNode is one of the building blocks for creating mixers. This interface is an AudioNode with a single input and single output, which multiplies the input audio signal by the (possibly time-varying) gain attribute, copying the result to the output.

property.name: gain
property.description: Represents the amount of gain to apply. Its default value is 1 (no gain change). The nominal minValue is 0, but may be set negative for phase inversion. The nominal maxValue is 1, but higher values are allowed (no exception thrown). This parameter is a-rate.

interface.name: OscillatorNode
interface.description: OscillatorNode represents an audio source generating a periodic waveform. It can be set to a few commonly used waveforms. Additionally, it can be set to an arbitrary periodic waveform through the use of a WaveTable object. Oscillators are common foundational building blocks in audio synthesis.

method.name: setWaveTable
method.description: Sets an arbitrary custom periodic waveform given a WaveTable.

method.name: start
method.description: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.

parameter.name: when
parameter.description: Describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should start playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will start playing immediately. start may only be called one time and must be called before stop is called or an exception will be thrown.

method.name: stop
method.description: Schedules a sound to stop playback at an exact time.

parameter.name: when
parameter.description: Describes at what time (in seconds) the sound should stop playing. It is in the same time coordinate system as AudioContext.currentTime. If 0 is passed in for this value or if the value is less than currentTime, then the sound will stop playing immediately. stop must only be called one time and only after a call to start or stop, or an exception will be thrown.

property.name: detune
property.description: A detuning value (in Cents) which will offset the frequency by the given amount. This parameter is a-rate.

property.name: frequency
property.description: The frequency (in Hertz) of the periodic waveform. This parameter is a-rate.

property.name: playbackState
property.description: The playback state, initialized to UNSCHEDULED_STATE, progressing through SCHEDULED_STATE, PLAYING_STATE, and FINISHED_STATE.

property.name: type
property.description: The shape of the periodic waveform. It may directly be set to any of the type constant values except for CUSTOM. The setWaveTable() method can be used to set a custom waveform, which results in this attribute being set to CUSTOM.

interface.name: PannerNode
interface.description: This interface represents a processing node which positions / spatializes an incoming audio stream in three-dimensional space. The spatialization is in relation to the AudioContext's AudioListener (listener attribute). The audio stream from the input will be either mono or stereo, depending on the connection(s) to the input. The output of this node is hard-coded to stereo (2 channels) and currently cannot be configured.

method.name: setOrientation
method.description: Describes which direction the audio source is pointing in the 3D cartesian coordinate space. Depending on how directional the sound is (controlled by the cone attributes), a sound pointing away from the listener can be very quiet or completely silent. The x, y, and z parameters represent a direction vector in 3D space. The default value is (1,0,0).

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Sets the position of the audio source relative to the listener attribute. A 3D cartesian coordinate system is used. The x, y, and z parameters represent the coordinates in 3D space. The default value is (0,0,0).

method.name: setVelocity
method.description: Sets the velocity vector of the audio source. This vector controls both the direction of travel and the speed in 3D space. This velocity relative to the listener's velocity is used to determine how much doppler shift (pitch change) to apply. The x, y, and z parameters describe a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity. The default value is (0,0,0).

property.name: coneInnerAngle
property.description: A parameter for directional audio sources, this is an angle inside of which there will be no volume reduction. The default value is 360.

property.name: coneOuterAngle
property.description: A parameter for directional audio sources, this is an angle outside of which the volume will be reduced to a constant value of coneOuterGain. The default value is 360.

property.name: coneOuterGain
property.description: A parameter for directional audio sources, this is the amount of volume reduction outside of the coneOuterAngle. The default value is 0.

property.name: distanceModel
property.description: Determines which algorithm will be used to reduce the volume of an audio source as it moves away from the listener. See below for the available choices. The default is INVERSE_DISTANCE.

property.name: maxDistance
property.description: The maximum distance between source and listener, after which the volume will not be reduced any further. The default value is 10000.

property.name: panningModel
property.description: Determines which spatialization algorithm will be used to position the audio in 3D space. See below for the available choices. The default is HRTF.

property.name: refDistance
property.description: A reference distance for reducing volume as source moves further from the listener. The default value is 1.

property.name: rolloffFactor
property.description: Describes how quickly the volume is reduced as source moves away from listener. The default value is 1.

interface.name: ScriptProcessorNode
interface.description: This interface is an AudioNode which can generate, process, or analyse audio directly using JavaScript.

property.name: bufferSize
property.description: The size of the buffer (in sample-frames) which needs to be processed each time onaudioprocess is called. Legal values are 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, and 16384.

property.name: onaudioprocess
property.description: An event listener which is called periodically for audio processing. An event of type AudioProcessingEvent will be passed to the event handler.

interface.name: WaveShaperNode
interface.description: WaveShaperNode is an AudioNode processor implementing non-linear distortion effects. Non-linear waveshaping distortion is commonly used for both subtle non-linear warming, or for more obvious distortion effects.

property.name: curve
property.description: The shaping curve used for the waveshaping effect. The input signal is nominally within the range -1 -> +1. Each input sample within this range will index into the shaping curve with a signal level of zero corresponding to the center value of the curve array. Any sample value less than -1 will correspond to the first value in the curve array. Any sample value less greater than +1 will correspond to the last value in the curve array.

interface.name: WaveTable
interface.description: WaveTable represents an arbitrary periodic waveform to be used with an OscillatorNode.

interface.name: LocalMediaStream
interface.description: The LocalMediaStream object is the MediaStream object returned from the call to getUserMedia(). It has all the properties and events of the MediaStream object and the stop method.

method.name: stop
method.description: Permanently halts the generation of data for the tracks' sources and removes the references to the sources.

interface.name: MediaStream
interface.description: The MediaStream interface of the WebRTC API describes a stream of audio or video data. A MediaStream object represents a linear, potentially infinite timeline. It is not preloadable, nor is it seekable.

property.name: audioTracks
property.description: The MediaStreamTrackList object representing the audio tracks.

property.name: ended
property.description: True if the ended event has fired on the MediaStream object.

property.name: label
property.description: A globally unique identifier (GUID) of 36 characters that describes the media stream.

property.name: onended
property.description: Handles the ended event when fired on the MediaStream object.

property.name: videoTracks
property.description: The MediaStreamTrackList object representing the video tracks.

interface.name: MediaStreamTrack
interface.description: A MediaStreamTrack is one of two kinds, audio or video, and represents the media source, such as a camera.

property.name: enabled
property.description: True if the track is still associated with its source.

property.name: kind
property.description: The value, either audio or video for the source of the track.

property.name: label
property.description: A user agent-assigned string that identifies the track source, as in "internal microphone."

property.name: onended
property.description: Handles the ended event when fired on the MediaStream object.

property.name: onmute
property.description: Handles the muted event when fired on the MediaStream object.

property.name: readyState
property.description: The track's ready state; values.

interface.name: MediaStreamTrackList
interface.description: A MediaStream has two MediaStreamTrackList objects, one for the video tracks and one for the audio tracks.

method.name: add
method.description: Adds a MediaStreamTrack to this track list.

parameter.name: track
parameter.description: MediaStreamTrack track, required.

method.name: item
method.description: Returns the MediaStreamTrack at the specified index value.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: unsigned long index, required.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes a MediaStreamTrack from this track list.

parameter.name: track
parameter.description: MediaStreamTrack track, required.

property.name: length
property.description: The number of tracks in the list.

property.name: onaddtrack
property.description: Handles the addtrack event.

property.name: onremovetrack
property.description: Handles the removetrack event.

interface.name: RTCDataChannel
interface.description: Represents a bi-directional data channel between two peers.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the RTCDataChannel.

method.name: send
method.description: Sends a message (data) on the RTCDataChannel’s underlying data transport.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description:
The send() method is overloaded to handle different data argument types. This parameter may be any of the following objects:

  • string -- a series of Unicode characters
  • Blob -- raw data represented by a Blob object
  • ArrayBuffer -- data directly stored in an ArrayBuffer object
  • ArrayBufferView -- data stored in a section of an ArrayBuffer object that the ArrayBufferview object references

property.name: binaryType
property.description: Returns the value to which it was last set; on creation, must be initialized to the string "blob".

property.name: bufferedAmount
property.description: Returns the number of bytes of application data that have been queued using send() but that (as of the last time the event loop started executing a task) have not yet been transmitted to the network.

property.name: label
property.description: A unique identifier that can be used to distinguish this RTCDataChannel object from other RTCDataChannel objects.

property.name: onclose
property.description: An event listener to be called when an RTCDataChannel is closed.

property.name: onerror
property.description: An event listener to be called when an error occurs.

property.name: onmessage
property.description: An event listener to be called when a message is received.

property.name: onopen
property.description: An event listener to be called when an RTCDataChannel is opened.

property.name: readyState
property.description: Represents the state of the RTCDataChannel object.

property.name: reliable
property.description: Returns true if the RTCDataChannel is reliable, and false otherwise.

interface.name: RTCPeerConnection
