interface.description: Provides for the connection between remote peers, the transmission of locally generated MediaStream data and arbitrary data between peers.

method.name: addIceCandidate
method.description: Provides a remote candidate to the ICE agent.

parameter.name: candidate
parameter.description: See RTCIceCandidate.

method.name: addStream
method.description: Adds a new stream to the RTCPeerConnection.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes a peer connection, stops all active ICE processing and any active streaming, and releases any relevant resources such as TURN permissions.

method.name: createAnswer
method.description: Creates a session description compatible with the remote configuration.

method.name: createDataChannel
method.description: Creates an RTCDataChannel object with the given label.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: The label of the data channel.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: Currently the only available option is a Boolean property named "reliable" (e.g. {reliable: false})

method.name: createOffer
method.description: Creates a session description compatible with the local configuration.

method.name: getIdentityAssertion
method.description: Provides an identity assertion.

method.name: getStats
method.description: Retrieves status information for a given MediaStreamTrack.

method.name: removeStream
method.description: Removes the given stream from the localStreams array in the RTCPeerConnection and fires the negotiationneeded event.

method.name: setIdentityProvider
method.description: Sets the identity provider. Not required if the browser is already configured for an identity provider.

method.name: setLocalDescription
method.description: Applies the supplied RTCSessionDescription to the local description.

method.name: setRemoteDescription
method.description: Applies the supplied RTCSessionDescription to the remote description.

method.name: updateIce
method.description: Updates the ICE agent process that gathers local candidates and remote candidates.

property.name: iceGatheringState
property.description: Returns the gathering state of the ICE agent.

property.name: iceState
property.description: Returns the ICE state of the ICE agent.

property.name: localDescription
property.description: Returns the RTCSessionDescription most recently passed to the setLocalDescription() method along with any local candidate descriptions generated since the method was called.

property.name: localStreams
property.description: Returns an array of MediaStream objects added to the connection with addStream().

property.name: onaddstream
property.description: Handles the addstream event fired when setRemoteDescription() is called.

property.name: ondatachannel
property.description: Handles the datachannel event.

property.name: ongatheringchange
property.description: Handles the gatheringchange event for a change to the iceGatheringState property.

property.name: onicecandidate
property.description: Handles the icechange event for a change to the [[apis/webrtc/RTCPeerConnection/iceState]] property. It is called any time there is a new ICE candidate added to a previous offer or answer.

property.name: onicechange
property.description: Handles the icechange event. It is called any time the iceState changes.

property.name: onidentityresult
property.description: Handles the identityresult event for the success or failure of an identity verification.

property.name: onnegotiationneeded
property.description: Handles the negotiationneeded event.

property.name: onopen
property.description:
Handles the open event.

Testing.

property.name: onremovestream
property.description: Handles the removestream event for when setRemoteDescription() is called to remove a MediaStream object on the remote peer.

property.name: onstatechange
property.description: Handles the statechange event for when the readyState property is changed, i.e. with a call to setLocalDescription() or setRemoteDescription(). The event does not fire when a new RTCPeerConnection object is created.

property.name: peerIdentity
property.description: Contains the peer identity assertion information if an identity assertion was provided and verified.

property.name: readyState
property.description: Returns the ready state of the peer connection.

property.name: remoteDescription
property.description: Returns the RTCSessionDescription most recently passed to the setRemoteDescription() method along with any remote candidate descriptions supplied with addIceCandidate(). Returns null if the remote description has not been set.

property.name: remoteStreams
property.description: Returns an array of MediaStream objects added to the connection by the remote peer. This array is updated when the addstream and removestream events are fired.

interface.name: RTCSessionDescription
interface.description: Describes the session with a serialized Session Description Protocol object.

property.name: sdp
property.description: The string representation of the SDP object.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of SDP object this RTCSessionDescription represents.

interface.name: CloseEvent
interface.description: Object representing the close event for a WebSocket.

property.name: code
property.description: The WebSocket connection close code provided by the server.

property.name: reason
property.description: Indicates the reason the server closed the WebSocket connection.

property.name: wasClean
property.description: Indicates whether the WebSocket connection was cleanly closed.

interface.name: MessageEvent
interface.description: A MessageEvent is sent to clients using WebSockets when data is received from the server. This is delivered to the listener indicated by the WebSocket object's onmessage attribute.

property.name: data
property.description: The data from the server.

interface.name: WebSocket
interface.description: Object for creating and managing a WebSocket connection to a server, as well as for sending and receiving data on the connection.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the WebSocket connection or connection attempt, if any.

parameter.name: code
parameter.description: A numeric value indicating the status code explaining why the connection is being closed. If this parameter is not specified, a default value of 1000 (indicating a normal "transaction complete" closure) is assumed.

parameter.name: reason
parameter.description: A human-readable string explaining why the connection is closing. This string must be no longer than 123 bytes of UTF-8 text (not characters).

method.name: send
method.description: Transmits data to the server over the WebSocket connection.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description:
Must be of one of the following types:

  • String
  • Blob
  • ArrayBuffer
  • ArrayBufferView

property.name: binaryType
property.description: Indicates the type of binary data being transmitted by the connection.

property.name: bufferedAmount
property.description: The number of bytes of data that have been queued using calls to send() but not yet transmitted to the network.

property.name: extensions
property.description: The extensions selected by the server.

property.name: onclose
property.description: An event listener to be called when the WebSocket connection's readyState changes to CLOSED. Receives a CloseEvent named "close".

property.name: onerror
property.description: An event listener to be called when an error occurs. Receives an event named "error".

property.name: onmessage
property.description: An event listener to be called when a message is received from the server. Receives a MessageEvent named "message".

property.name: onopen
property.description: An event listener to be called when the WebSocket connection's readyState changes to OPEN. Receives an event named "open".

property.name: protocol
property.description: Indicates the name of the sub-protocol the server selected.

property.name: readyState
property.description: The current state of the connection, represented as a numeric constant.

property.name: url
property.description: The absolute URL as resolved by the constructor.

interface.name: Worker
interface.description: An object representing a worker, that is used to communicate with the worker.

method.name: postMessage
method.description: Posts a message to the worker with which the object is associated.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description:
This argument can be structured data, e.g.:

worker.postMessage({opcode: 'activate', device: 1938, parameters: [23, 102]});

method.name: terminate
method.description: Immediately terminates the worker with which the object is associated.

property.name: onerror
property.description: An event listener to be called when an error occurs.

property.name: onmessage
property.description: An event listener to be called when a message is received from the worker.

interface.name: WorkerGlobalScope
interface.description: An object representing the "inside" of a worker.

method.name: close
method.description: Discards any pending tasks and immediately closes the worker.

method.name: importScripts
method.description: Fetches one or more script resources, identified by absolute URLs.

property.name: location
property.description: Returns the WorkerLocation object created for the WorkerGlobalScope object when the worker was created.

property.name: navigator
property.description: Returns an instance of the WorkerNavigator interface, which represents the identity and state of the user agent (the client).

property.name: onerror
property.description: An event listener to be called when an error occurs.

property.name: onoffline
property.description: An event listener to be called when the worker goes offline.

property.name: ononline
property.description: An event listener to be called when the worker goes online.

property.name: self
property.description: Returns the WorkerGlobalScope object.

interface.name: WorkerLocation
interface.description: An object representing an absolute URL, set at the worker's creation.

property.name: href
property.description: Returns the absolute URL that the object represents.

interface.name: WorkerNavigator
interface.description: An object representing the identity and state of the user agent (the client).

interface.name: XMLHttpRequest
interface.description: XMLHttpRequest allows JavaScript to make HTTP requests, and is the most basic part of AJAX. It allows a website to dynamically request more content, without reloading the entire page.

method.name: abort
method.description: Stops an asynchronous XMLHttpRequest in progress.

method.name: getAllResponseHeaders
method.description: Returns all the response headers as a string, or null if no response has been received.

method.name: getResponseHeader
method.description: Returns the string containing the text of the specified header, or null if the response has not been received or the header does not exist.

parameter.name: header
parameter.description: String that specifies the response header name.

method.name: open
method.description: Initializes an XMLHttpRequest.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: Specifies the HTTP method used to open the connection, such as GET, POST, or HEAD. This parameter is not case-sensitive.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: Specifies either an absolute or relative URL of the XML data or server-side Web services.

parameter.name: async
parameter.description:
Specifies

true for asynchronous operation (the call returns immediately), or

false for synchronous operation.

If true, assign a callback handler to

the onreadystatechange property

to determine when the call has completed.

If not specified, the default is true.

method.name: getBoundingClientRect
method.description:
Returns a ClientRect object that encloses a group of text rectangles.

The returned value is a ClientRect object which is the union of the rectangles returned by getClientRects() for the element, i.e., the CSS border-boxes associated with the element. It contains read-only left, top, right and bottom properties describing the border-box, in pixels, with the top-left relative to the top-left of the viewport.
method.return_description:
ClientRect

top: Number

left: Number

right: Number

bottom: Number

width: Number

height: Number

method.name: getClientRects
method.description: The returned value is a collection of ClientRect objects, one for each CSS border box associated with the element. Each ClientRect object contains read-only left, top, right and bottom properties describing the border box, in pixels, with the top-left relative to the top-left of the viewport. For tables with captions, the caption is included even though it's outside the border box of the table.
method.return_description:
A ClientRectList collection, that contains ClientRect objects with the following properties -

top: Number

left: Number

right: Number

bottom: Number

height: Number

width: Number

property.name: all
property.description: Obsolete. Do not use. Use documentOrElement.querySelectorAll("*") instead. Returns a live HTMLAllCollection collection of descendant elements of a Document or an Element.

property.name: canHaveChildren
property.description: Non standard. Gets whether the element can contain children and so is available for children related manipulations like appendChild.

property.name: draggable
property.description: Gets or sets whether an element can be dragged and dropped.

property.name: ATOMICSELECTION html attribute
property.description: Specifies whether the element and its contents must be selected as a whole, indivisible unit.

property.name: BaseHref
property.description: Retrieves a string of the URL where the object tag can be found, often the href of the document that the object is in, or the value set by a base element.

property.name: STYLE html attribute
property.description: Sets an inline style for the element.

property.name: abbr
property.description: Indicates an abbreviation or an acronym.

property.name: accept
property.description: Sets or retrieves a comma-separated list of content types.

property.name: accessKey
property.description: Sets a keyboard keystroke for selection of its element, which would otherwise be done using a mouse.

property.name: action
property.description: Sets or retrieves the URL to which the form content is sent for processing.

property.name: align (Table caption, legend element)
property.description: Sets or retrieves a value that indicates the table alignment.

property.name: align (Table, iframe elements)
property.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the content in an element. Not supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead.

property.name: alinkColor
property.description: Sets or gets the color of all active links in the document.

property.name: allowTransparency
property.description: Sets or retrieves whether the object can be transparent.

property.name: async
property.description: Provides control of when a script executes while a document loads.

property.name: autocomplete (input, form elements)
property.description: Specifies whether a form should have autocomplete on or off. When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before.

property.name: autofocus
property.description: Provides a way to direct a user to a specific field when a document loads. This can provide both direction and convenience for a user, reducing the need to click or tab to a field when a page opens. This attribute is true when present on an element, and false when missing.

property.name: background (Body element)
property.description: Specifies a background image for a document. This attribute is deprecated in HTML4 and not supported in HTML5. Use CSS.

property.id: html/attributes/background (Table, table cell, td, th elements)
property.name: background (Table, table cell, td, th elements)
property.description: Specifies up to five separate background properties of an object.

property.name: bgColor
property.description: Specifies the background color of a document. This is deprecated in HTML4 and not supported in HTML5.

property.name: bgColor (document)
property.description: Deprecated. Sets or retrieves the background color behind the object.

property.name: border
property.description: Specifies the width of the border around an element. Deprecated in HTML4, not supported in HTML5. Use CSS.

property.name: border (frameSet, iframe)
property.description: Sets or retrieves the space between the frames, including the 3-D border.

property.name: borderColor
property.description: Specifies the border color of the object.

property.name: borderColorLight
property.description: Sets the colors of the upper and left corners of the cell. Used with borderColorDark to set the lighter colors in an element's shaded border. Deprecated in HTML4, unsupported in HTML5. Use CSS.

property.name: cellPadding
property.description: Specifies the space, in pixels, between the cell wall and the cell content. Not supported in HTML5. Use CSS.

property.name: cells
property.description: Retrieves a collection of all cells in the table row or in the entire table.

property.name: ch
property.description: Sets an alignment character. The first occurrence of the alignment character in each cell in a column will be on a vertical axis.

property.name: chOff
property.description: Removes an alignment character set by the attribute ch.

property.name: checked
property.description: Sets or retrieves the state of the check box or radio button.

property.name: class
property.description: Specifies one or more classnames for an element, usually used to point to a class in a style sheet.

property.name: classid
property.description: Sets or retrieves the class identifier for the object.

property.name: code
property.description: Defines a piece of computer code. Renders in fixed-width characters.

property.name: codeBase
property.description: Sets or retrieves the URL of the component.

property.name: color
property.description: The foreground color of the text of an object.

property.name: cols (frameSet)
property.description: Sets or retrieves the number of columns in the table.

property.name: contentEditable
property.description: Sets or retrieves the string that indicates whether the user can edit the content of the object.

property.name: dataFld
property.description: Sets or retrieves a field of a given data source, as specified by the dataSrc property, to bind to the specified object.

property.name: dataSrc
property.description: Sets or retrieves the source of the data for data binding.

property.name: defer
property.description: Sets or retrieves the status of the script.

property.name: dir
property.description: Global attribute. Specifies the element’s text directionality.

property.name: encoding
property.description: Sets or retrieves the MIME encoding for the form.

property.name: face
property.description: Sets or retrieves the current typeface family.

property.name: formMethod
property.description: Overrides the submit method attribute previously specified on a form element.

property.name: frameBorder
property.description: Sets or retrieves whether to display a border for the frame.

property.name: height
property.description: Sets or retrieves the height of the object.

property.name: href
property.description: Sets or retrieves a destination URL or an anchor point

property.name: hspace
property.description: Sets or retrieves the horizontal margin for the object.

property.name: isMap
property.description: Indicates that an image is part of a server-side image-map.

property.name: lang
property.description: Sets or retrieves the language to use.

property.name: link
property.description: Enables the current document to establish links to external documents.

property.name: loop
property.description: Sets or retrieves the number of times a sound or video clip will loop when activated.

property.name: marginWidth
property.description: Sets or retrieves the left and right margin widths before displaying the text in a frame.

property.name: max (HTMLInputElement)
property.description: Reflects the max HTML attribute, containing the maximum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

property.name: min
property.description: Reflects the min HTML attribute, containing the minimum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

property.name: standby
property.description: A message for the browser to show while an object's implementation and data load.

property.name: step
property.description: Specify the increment for input with types number, time, or range

interface.name: PointerEvent
interface.description: Provides contextual information associated with input events (for example, from mouse, touch or pen).

method.name: initPointerEvent
method.description: Initializes a new PointerEvent created by the createEvent method.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the event being created, such as: pointerdown, pointerup, pointercancel, pointermove, pointerover, pointerout, pointerenter, pointerleave, gotpointercapture, lostpointercapture.

parameter.name: ctrlKey
parameter.description:
Indicates the state of the Ctrl key.

When true, the left or right Ctrl key is pressed.

If false, neither Ctrl key is pressed.

parameter.name: altKey
parameter.description:
Indicates the state of the Alt key.

When true, the left or right Alt key is pressed.

If false, neither Alt key is pressed.

parameter.name: shiftKey
parameter.description:
Indicates the state of the Shift key.

When true, the left or right Shift key is pressed.

If false, neither Shift key is pressed.

parameter.name: metaKey
parameter.description:
Indicates the state of the Meta/Command key.

If true, the left or right Meta/Command key is pressed.

If false

neither Meta/Command key is pressed.

parameter.name: button
parameter.description: If the event is caused by a mouse event, this indicates the mouse button that caused the event.

parameter.name: relatedTarget
parameter.description: A reference to the related element.

parameter.name: offsetX
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the event in the element.

parameter.name: offsetY
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the event in the element.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The contact width of the pointer point specified by pointerId. Default: 0

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The contact height of the pointer point specified by pointerId. Default: 0

parameter.name: canBubble
parameter.description:
Indicates whether the event can bubble.

When true, the event should propagate upward.

When false, the event does not propagate upward.

parameter.name: pressure
parameter.description: Pen pressure normalized in a range of 0 to 255. Default: 0

parameter.name: tiltX
parameter.description:
The plane angle between the Y-Z plane and the plane containing the transducer axis and the Y axis. A positive X Tilt is to the right.

This quantity is used in conjunction with Y Tilt to represent the tilt away from normal of a transducer, such as a stylus.

Range: -90 to +90

Default: 0

parameter.name: tiltY
parameter.description:
Represents the angle between the X-Z and transducer-X planes.

A positive Y Tilt is toward the user.

Range: -90 to +90

Default: 0

parameter.name: pointerId
parameter.description: Specifies the unique ID of the contact. Default: 0

parameter.name: pointerType
parameter.description: Indicates whether the source is touch, pen or mouse. Default: ""

parameter.name: isPrimary
parameter.description: Indicates whether this is the primary pointer that is used to control the mouse position in a multi-touch scenario. Default: false

parameter.name: cancelable
parameter.description:
Indicates whether the event’s default action can be prevented.

When true, the default action can be canceled.

When false, the default action cannot be canceled.

parameter.name: view
parameter.description: The view in which the event is taking place.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: Specifies some detailed information depending upon the event.

parameter.name: screenX
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the event in screen coordinates relative to the upper left corner of the screen.

parameter.name: screenY
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the event in screen coordinates relative to the upper left corner of the screen.

parameter.name: clientX
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the event in client coordinates relative to the upper-left corner of the document's client area.

parameter.name: clientY
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the event in client coordinates relative to the upper-left corner of the document's client area.

property.name: height
property.description: The height (magnitude on the Y axis), in CSS pixels, of the contact geometry of the pointer.

property.name: isPrimary
property.description: Indicates if the pointer represents the primary pointer.

property.name: pointerId
property.description: A unique identifier for the pointer causing the event

property.name: pointerType
property.description: Indicates the device type that caused the event (mouse, pen, touch, etc.).

property.name: pressure
property.description: The normalized pressure of the pointer input in the range of [0,1], where 0 and 1 represent the minimum and maximum pressure the hardware is capable of detecting, respectively.

property.name: tiltX
property.description: The plane angle (in degrees, in the range of [-90,90]) between the Y-Z plane and the plane containing both the transducer (e.g. pen stylus) axis and the Y axis.

property.name: tiltY
property.description: The plane angle (in degrees, in the range of [-90,90]) between the X-Z plane and the plane containing both the transducer (e.g. pen stylus) axis and the X axis.

property.name: width
property.description: The width (magnitude on the X axis), in CSS pixels, of the contact geometry of the pointer.

method.name: getUserMedia
method.description: Prompts the user for permission to use a media device such as a camera or microphone. If the user provides permission, the successCallback is invoked on the calling application with a LocalMediaStream object as its argument.

parameter.name: constraints
parameter.description:
The constraints parameter is a MediaStreamConstraints object with two Boolean members: video and audio. These describe the media types supporting the LocalMediaStream object. Either or both must be specified to validate the constraint argument. If a specified constraint is not supported by the browser, getUserMedia invokes the errorCallback with the NOT_SUPPORTED_ERROR. If the browser cannot find any media track with the specified type, getUserMedia invokes the errorCallback with the MANDATORY_UNSATISFIED_ERR.

If the value or the member is not specified in the object, the value for the member defaults to false. The following demonstrates how to set the constraints for both audio and video:

{ video: true, audio: true }

parameter.name: successCallback
parameter.description:
The getUserMedia function will call the function specified in the successCallback with the LocalMediaStream object that contains the media stream. You may assign that object to the appropriate element and work with it, as shown in the following example:

function(localMediaStream) {

var video = document.querySelector('video');

video.src = window.URL.createObjectURL(localMediaStream);

video.onloadedmetadata = function(e) {

// Do something with the video here.

};

},

parameter.name: errorCallback
parameter.description:
The getUserMedia function will call the function specified in the errorCallback with a code argument. The error codes are described as follows:

  • PERMISSION_DENIED - The user denied permission to use a media device required for the operation.
  • NOT_SUPPORTED_ERROR - A constraint specified is not supported by the browser.
  • MANDATORY_UNSATISFIED_ERROR - No media tracks of the type specified in the constraints are found.

  • Scroll - The Scroll Lock toggle.

interface.name: TextEvent
interface.description: Represents a text event that usually occurs when text is actually inserted into the document.

parameter.name: eventType
parameter.description: The name of the event. Sets the value for the type property.

parameter.name: canBubble
parameter.description: Whether the event propagates upward. Sets the value for the bubbles property.

parameter.name: cancelable
parameter.description: Whether the event is cancelable and so preventDefault can be called. Sets the value for the cancelable property.

parameter.name: view
parameter.description: The window on which this event is occurring. Sets the value for the view property.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: Character data. Sets the value for the data property.

parameter.name: inputMethod
parameter.description: The input mode for the text. Sets the value for the inputMethod property.

parameter.name: locale
parameter.description: The locale name. Sets the value for the locale property.

property.name: inputMethod
property.description: Gets a value that describes how text is entered.

interface.name: UIEvent
interface.description: Represents a user interface event, like click, blur and more.

method.name: initUIEvent
method.description: Initializes a new user interface event that the createEvent method created.

parameter.name: eventType
parameter.description: The name of the event. Sets the value for the type property.

parameter.name: canBubble
parameter.description: Whether the event propagates upward. Sets the value for the bubbles property.

parameter.name: cancelable
parameter.description: Whether the event is cancelable and so preventDefault can be called. Sets the value for the cancelable property.

parameter.name: view
parameter.description: The window on which this event is occurring. Sets the value for the view property.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: Specifies additional information. This value is returned in the detail property of the event.

property.name: detail

property.name: view

interface.name: WheelEvent
interface.description: Represents a mousewheel event.

parameter.name: eventType
parameter.description: The name of the event. Sets the value for the type property.

parameter.name: button
parameter.description: The mouse button that caused the event. Sets the value for the button property (see the property page for common values).

parameter.name: relatedTarget
parameter.description: A secondary element that is involved in the event. Sets the value for the relatedTarget property.

parameter.name: modifiersListArg
parameter.description:
A space-separated list of any of the following values:

  • Alt - The left or right Alt key.
  • AltGraph - The Ctrl and Alt keys.
  • CapsLock - The Caps Lock toggle.
  • Control - The left or right Ctrl key.
  • Meta - The Meta/Control key.
  • NumLock - The Num Lock toggle.
  • ScrollLock - The Scroll Lock toggle.
  • Shift - The left or right Shift key.
  • Fn
  • OS
  • SymbolLock

Other implementation specific options may be supported.

For example -

  • Win (on Microsoft Windows) - The left or right Windows logo key.
  • Scroll - The Scroll Lock toggle.

parameter.name: deltaX
parameter.description: The distance that the mouse wheel has rotated around the x-axis. Sets the value for the deltaX property.

parameter.name: deltaY
parameter.description: The distance that the mouse wheel has rotated around the y-axis. Sets the value for the deltaY property.

parameter.name: deltaZ
parameter.description: The distance that the mouse wheel has rotated around the z-axis. Sets the value for the deltaZ property.

parameter.name: deltaMode
parameter.description: The delta mode of the event. Sets the value for the deltaMode property (see the property page for common values).

parameter.name: canBubble
parameter.description: Whether the event propagates upward. Sets the value for the bubbles property.

parameter.name: cancelable
parameter.description: Whether the event is cancelable and so preventDefault can be called. Sets the value for the cancelable property.

parameter.name: view
parameter.description: The window on which this event is occurring. Sets the value for the view property.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: Specifies additional information. This value is returned in the detail property of the event.

parameter.name: screenX
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the mouse pointer, relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. Sets the value for the screenX property,

parameter.name: screenY
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the mouse pointer, relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. Sets the value for the screenY property.

parameter.name: clientX
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of the mouse pointer, relative to the upper-left corner of the browser's client area. Sets the value for the clientX property.

parameter.name: clientY
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of the mouse pointer, relative to the upper-left corner of the browser's client area. Sets the value for the clientY property.

property.name: deltaMode
property.description: Gets a value that indicates the unit of measurement for delta values.

property.name: deltaX
property.description: Gets the distance that a mouse wheel has rotated around the x-axis (horizontal).

property.name: deltaY
property.description: Gets the distance that a mouse wheel has rotated around the y-axis (vertical).

property.name: deltaZ
property.description: Gets the distance that a mouse wheel has rotated around the z-axis.

property.name: wheelDelta
property.description: Non standard. Proprietary. Gets the distance that a mouse wheel has rotated around the y-axis.

interface.name: DataTransfer
interface.description: Represents an object associated with drag and drop or clipboard events, providing the utility operations.

method.name: clearData
method.description: Removes one or more data formats from the clipboard through the dataTransfer object or the clipboardData object.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description:
The format of the data to be cleared, using one of the following values (case insensitve) -

  • URL
  • Text

method.name: getData
method.description: Gets the data in the specified format from the clipboard through the dataTransfer object or the clipboardData object.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description:
The format of the data to be transferred, using one of the following values (case insensitve) -

  • URL
  • Text

method.name: setData
method.description: Assigns data in a specified format to the dataTransfer object or the clipboardData object.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description:
The format of the data to be transferred, using one of the following values (case insensitve) -

  • URL
  • Text

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: Specifies the data supplied by the source object. This information can be descriptive text, a source path to an image, or a URL for an anchor. When you pass "URL" as the format parameter, you must use the data parameter to provide the location of the object that is transferred.

property.name: dropEffect
property.description: Sets or gets the type of drag-and-drop operation and the type of cursor to display.

property.name: effectAllowed
property.description: Sets or gets which data transfer operations are allowed for the object on the source element.

property.name: types
property.description: Returns a string list of formats that were sent in the ondragstart event.

interface.name: ShadowRoot
interface.description: The ShadowRoot object is the point of entry to a shadow tree, which provides functional encapsulation of DOM objects within an established document.

method.name: addStyleSheet
method.description: Adds a new style sheet to shadow root style sheets.

method.description: Returns an element at specified coordinates.
method.return_description: If x is greater than the viewport width or if y is greater than the viewport height, excluding the size of any rendered scrollbars, returns null.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The horizontal position of the element. May not be negative.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The vertical position of the element. May not be negative.

method.name: getElementById
method.description: Just like document.getElementById except that it only works within the scope of this ShadowRoot's shadow tree.
method.return_description: Returns the DOM node specified by the given ID. Case matters, and if there is more than one node with the given ID, which node is returned is uncertain.

method.name: getElementsByClassName
method.description: Just like document.getElementsByClassName except that it only works within the scope of this ShadowRoot's shadow tree.
method.return_description: A live HTMLCollection of elements with the given class names.

parameter.name: classNames
parameter.description: A space separated list of classes.

method.name: getElementsByTagName
method.description: Just like document.getElementsByTagName except that it only works within the scope of this ShadowRoot's shadow tree.
method.return_description: A DOM collection of elements with the given name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the element's tag.

method.name: getElementsByTagNameNS
method.description: Just like document.getElementsByTagNameNS except that it only works within the scope of this ShadowRoot's shadow tree.
method.return_description: An IHTMLElementCollection of elements within the namespace.

parameter.name: pvarNS
parameter.description: The namespace URI that defines the desired elements or an asterisk (*) to match all namespaces with the document.

parameter.name: bstrLocalName
parameter.description: The name of the desired element or an asterisk (*) to match all elements with the specified namespace.

method.name: getSelection
method.description: Returns the current selection in this ShadowRoot's shadow tree.

method.name: removeStyleSheet
method.description: Removes a style sheet from the ShadowRoot.
method.return_description: The removed style sheet instance.

property.name: activeElement
property.description: Represents the currently focused element in the shadow tree.

property.name: applyAuthorStyles
property.description: Indicates whether the rules in author styles associated with the element's document apply to the shadow tree. If false (default value), the author styles are not applied to the shadow tree. If true, the author styles are applied.

property.name: innerHTML
property.description: Represents the markup of the ShadowRoot's contents.

property.name: resetStyleInheritance
property.description: Indicates whether or not the inheritable CSS properties are set to the initial value at the shadow boundary. If false (default value), the properties continue to inherit. If true, the properties are set to initial value.

property.name: styleSheets
property.description: Represents the shadow root style sheets.

method.name: setInterval
method.return_description:
Integer

Integer. Returns an identifier that cancels the timer with the clearInterval method.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description:
Variant that specifies a function pointer or string indicating the code to be executed when the specified interval has elapsed.

Passing a string as a parameter suffers the same hazards as eval(), so it is generally recommended to pass a function pointer instead.

parameter.name: msec
parameter.description:
Integerthat specifies the number of milliseconds.

Note that there may be a minimum interval for this function. See setTimeout.

parameter.name: language
parameter.description: Stringthat specifies any one of the possible values for the LANGUAGE attribute.
